Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Portrait of a Burmese woman
Description:
Portrait of a Burmese woman
A posed studio portrait of a young Burmese woman, traditionally dressed in a patterned silk 'longyi' or wraparound skirt. Her hair is worn up and she stands against a back cloth painted with a forest scene. Leaves are scattered around her feet and she holds a 'cheroot' (a type of cigar) in one hand. Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
Caption reads: 'A Wuntho Beauty, no.459'
caption: Portrait of a Burmese woman

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Assault on Pinlebu
Description:
Assault on Pinlebu
British and Indian soldiers in the Second Mountain Battery of the Royal Artillery pose with artillery guns as they re-enact their assault on Pinlebu. The company was involved in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (today known as the Sagaing Division). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Centre Section 2nd Mountain Battery R.A. under Comd of Left. Marshall, firing on Penlibu. No. 414'
caption: Assault on Pinlebu

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Stone 'zeidis' at Wuntho
Description:
Stone 'zeidis' at Wuntho
Several carved stone 'zeidis' or pagodas are guarded by stone 'chinthes' (mythical Burmese lions) at Wuntho. This scene was captured shortly after British forces took control of Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Pagodas at Wuntho. No.420'
caption: Stone 'zeidis' at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: General Wolseley at Kyaing-Kwintaung
Description:
General Wolseley at Kyaing-Kwintaung
General George Wolseley and other senior British Army officers pose for the camera inside the captured Kyaing-Kwintaung stockade. The stronghold was seized from the Saopha of Wuntho and his rebel supporters, who opposed British attempts to annex areas of Burma (Myanmar). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Genl. Wolseley & Staff in the Kyaing-Kwintaung Stockade. No. 436'
caption: General Wolseley at Kyaing-Kwintaung

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Group photograph including the Saopha of Wuntha's wife
Description:
The Saopha of Wuntha's wife
Outdoors portrait of the Saopha of Wuntho's wife and young son, surrounded by female attendants. The group kneel on a mat laden with lacquerware tiffin boxes in the shade of two large parasols. Saopha Maung Aung Myat had taken over leadership of Wuntho in 1881, although the state remained outside British administration until it was formally annexed in 1892. Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
Caption reads: 'Sawbwa's of Wuntho's Wife & Family. No. 400'
caption: Group photograph including the Saopha of Wuntha's wife

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of Wuntho, Burma
Description:
View of Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar)
View of Wuntho showing the town's palace (left) and several carved stone 'zeidis' or pagodas. British Army soldiers stand near their tents in the foreground, pictured shortly after British forces captured Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Genl. View at Wuntho. No.427'
caption: View of Wuntho, Burma

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Street scene in Wuntho
Description:
Street scene in Wuntho
A group of Wuntho townspeople mill about outside a shrine containing carved stone 'zeidis' or pagodas. This scene was captured shortly after British forces took control of Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'A Street in Wuntho. No.440'
caption: Street scene in Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Stockade built by Lieutenant Chapman
Description:
Stockade built by Lieutenant Chapman
British and Indian soldiers pause for the camera during the construction of a stockade overseen by Lieutenant R.E. Chapman. Possibly a mix of British Army and Military Police officers, the men were involved in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (Sagaing Division). Youngma, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Stockade built by Left. Chapman, R.E. at Youngma. No. 452'
caption: Stockade built by Lieutenant Chapman

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Welcome arch for the Duke of Connaught, Hong Kong
Description:
A decorative welcome arch spans a city street in honour of the Duke of Connaught, who visited Hong Kong shortly before a devastating typhoon struck the city on 18 September. 

Original manuscript caption: Note! Small tableaux suspended from centre of arch over roadway depicting historical Chinese scene.
caption: Welcome arch for the Duke of Connaught, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Vegetable stall at an outdoor market in Seoul
Description:
A street trader wearing a 'gat' (a traditional Korean hat), crouches down to arrange the vegetables on his stall at a busy outdoor market. Other traders and customers mill about in the background. 

Original manuscript caption: Seoul, Korea.
caption: Vegetable stall at an outdoor market in Seoul

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Two Chinese men carry a pig
Description:
Two Chinese men carry a pig in a wicker cage suspended from a pole, Hong Kong.

Original manuscript caption: Usual method of carrying a pig
caption: Two Chinese men carry a pig

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Traditional Japanese dress
Description:
A person (probably male) dressed in traditional Japanese costume, walks away from the camera. He wears a striped kimono tied with an 'obi' (wide belt), and a large, wide-brimmed hat decorated with a plume of feathers. 

Original manuscript caption: Moji - Japan Strange head-dress.
caption: Traditional Japanese dress

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Gyeonghoeru Pavilion at Gyeongbok Palace
Description:
The Gyeonghoeru Pavilion at Gyeongbok Palace, situated on an island at the centre of a lotus pond. The building features a curved roof, which rests on 48 granite pillars. 

Original manuscript caption: Korea - Imperial Palace at Seoul - Lotus beds solid granite pillars.  Decorated ceiling.
caption: The Gyeonghoeru Pavilion at Gyeongbok Palace

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Statues of deities inside a Chinese Joss house
Description:
The statues of two Chinese deities ('Joss'), possibly idols of the Jade Emperor, sit side-by-side at the altar of a Joss house, Hong Kong. 

Original manuscript caption: Inside a Joss House - Two Joss
caption: Statues of deities inside a Chinese Joss house

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Statue of a Chinese warrior at the Ming Dynasty tombs
Description:
One of several ancient stone statues, depicting Chinese warriors in battle dress, that guide the way to the Ming Dynasty tombs. The site contains the mausoleums of 13 Emperors of the Chinese Ming Dynasty (1368-1644). Near Peking, (Beijing).

Original manuscript caption: Priest or Statesman
caption: Statue of a Chinese warrior at the Ming Dynasty tombs

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Queen's Road Central, Hong Kong
Description:
View along Queen's Road Central, looking east. Multi-storey colonial buildings line the street, which is dotted with pedestrians and rickshaws. An original caption points out the base of the Pedder Street clock tower on the left, a structure that was demolished in 1908. 

Original manuscript caption: Queen's Road Central looking East
On the lefthand side is base of Blake Clock Tower, then basement of Hong Kong Hotel. Pathways are not seen, as they are under archways and so covered in. Note Sikh Policeman down road in centre, also typical rickshas [sic] for hire & typical coolie with broad-brimmed cane hat on right. Our offices opposite Clock Tower on right, not shown in picture. This street is the principle street in Hong Kong, but it is not a busy time of day. Distant view of one part of peak.
caption: Queen's Road Central, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Peak Hospital in Hong Kong
Description:
Exterior view of the south side of Peak Hospital, Hong Kong,  a two-storey, stuccoed building with a curved façade on its left wing. 

Original manuscript caption: Peak Hospital. South front
caption: Peak Hospital in Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Mendicants beg by the roadside, China
Description:
A number of mendicants, some of whom are suffering from leprosy, beg at the roadside with their woven bowls. Both men and women wear wide-brimmed conical hats. 

Original manuscript caption: Beggars and Lepers. Shikwan
caption: Mendicants beg by the roadside, China

caption: Letter-writing service on a Hong Kong street

caption: Korean labourers transporting firewood

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives

Description:
The second head office of the Hong Kong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Ltd., built in 1886 with a portico and octagonal dome. 

Original manuscript caption: Hong Kong & Shanghai Bank, Head Office Hong Kong.
The premier commercial house in China
caption: Head office of the Hong Kong and Shanghai Bank

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives

Description:
A gateway, decorated with a pagoda-style roof, leads to Kowloon Harbour. Half-torn posters covered with Chinese script remain pasted to its façade. 

Original manuscript caption: Gateway at water edge Kowloon Old City Hong Kong
caption: Gateway to Kowloon Harbour

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Ear cleaning at a barber's shop, China
Description:
A man with a distinctive Manchu hairstyle sits on a stool to have his ears cleaned at a barber's shop. Several false 'queues' (waist-long pigtails), hang on the wall behind him; an equivalent to modern-day hair extensions. 

Original manuscript caption: Ear cleaning in Barber's Shop
Note false queues on wall. How up-to-date China is: even practice of wearing false hair has reached us from Europe?
caption: Ear cleaning at a barber's shop, China

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Ear cleaning at a barber's shop, China
Description:
A man sits on a stool to have his ears cleaned at a barber's shop. An elderly man with a long, plaited 'queue' (waist-long pigtail) sits nearby, waiting his turn. 

Original manuscript caption: Ear-cleaning a regular operation like shaving.
caption: Ear cleaning at a barber's shop, China

Original manuscript caption: Interior of Joss House.
caption: An altar inside a Hong Kong Joss house

caption: A Korean peddler boy

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Chinese burial urns
Description:
A number of burial urns, containing exhumed human bones, are grouped together on a hillside. Living relatives considered their fortunes to be directly linked to the positioning of the urns, and favoured locations with a positive 'feng shui' (natural harmony). Probably Hong Kong.

Original manuscript caption: Potted Ancestors - an old Cemetery
caption: Chinese burial urns

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: An empty road in Wuntho
Description:
An empty road in Wuntho
Two street-sellers sit in the shade of a thatched awning, waiting to offer their wares to passers-by at the side of an empty road. This scene was captured shortly after British forces took control of Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Street view in Wuntho. No.419'
caption: An empty road in Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Indian officers from the Ye-U Battalion of Military Police
Description:
The Ye-U Battalion of Military Police
Indian officers from the Ye-U Battalion of Military Police stand to attention, their guns held upright. Led by Captain Hutchinson, the company supported the British Army in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (today known as the Sagaing Division). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'The Ye-U Battalion Military Police Commanded by Capt. Hutchinson.  No. 454'
caption: Indian officers from the Ye-U Battalion of Military Police

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Burmese rebels surrender at Wuntho
Description:
Burmese rebels surrender at Wuntho
Captured Burmese rebels surrender their arms to British forces under a general amnesty. Allied to the Saopha of Wuntho, their opposition to the British annexation of Burma (Mynamar) led to conflict at Wuntho where they subsequently lost control of the area. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'The Sawbwa's Troops Surrendering Arms to the British authorities at Wuntho, No. 422'
caption: Burmese rebels surrender at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Deserted shrine at Wuntho
Description:
Deserted shrine at Wuntho
Several carved stone 'zeidis' or pagodas emerge from the undergrowth at a deserted shrine. This scene was captured shortly after British forces took control of Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Deserted Shrine at Wuntho. No.431'
caption: Deserted shrine at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of Wuntho, Burma
Description:
View of Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar)
View of Wuntho showing dwellings with thatched roofs supported on stilts, with Wuntho Palace in the distance. This scene was captured shortly after British forces took control of the town following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'View at Wuntho. No.423'
caption: View of Wuntho, Burma

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Soldiers at a deserted shrine
Description:
Soldiers at a deserted shrine
British Army soldiers pose informally at a deserted shrine containing several carved stone 'zeidis' or pagodas. The group are pictured shortly after British forces captured Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Deserted Shrine at Wuntho. No.435'
caption: Soldiers at a deserted shrine

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Ferries on the Ayeyarwady River
Description:
Ferries on the Ayeyarwady River
Two ferries containing soldiers from the Second Mountain Battery of the Royal Artillery are moored alongside a sandy bank of the Ayeyarwady River. The company was involved in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (Sagaing Division). Htagaing, Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
Caption reads: 'Embarking 2nd. Mountain Battery R.A onboard the B.G.S. "Patrick" at Htigaing. No.442'
caption: Ferries on the Ayeyarwady River

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of the Ayeyarwady River
Description:
View of the Ayeyarwady River
View across the Ayeyarwady River showing several ferry boats moored alongside the riverbank. Htagaing, Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
Caption reads: 'The River at Htigaing.  No.439'
caption: View of the Ayeyarwady River

Chinese women at a railway station on the Peking (Beijing) to Hankow (Hankou) railway line. Their feet have been bound, a practice that was ended in 1911 by the new Republic of China.

caption: Promenade at Hong Kong's Botanical Gardens

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Peak Tramway, Hong Kong
Description:
View of the Peak Tramway, a funicular railway leading to Victoria Peak. The traction cable used to power the cars is visible in the centre of the tracks, with a small footbridge crossing the line in the distance. 

Original manuscript caption: "No. 5 Hong Kong 1903   The Peak tramway [a portion].  Looking up from lower terminus.  The portion above the Bridge is very steep ascent.  The traction cable seen on the Rollers  - the second longtitudinal line from right of picture.  The cable is connected to each of the two cars so that the pull of one car descending helps to pull the other car up  - the surplus energy required being supplied by stationary engine at the top terminus. The cars run about every 10 or 15 minutes
time 10 minutes from top to bottom. Ascent 1000 feet"
caption: Peak Tramway, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Statue of Justice, Hong Kong Law Courts
Description:
Photograph of Statue of Justice standing outside of Law Courts in Hong Kong. Printed caption states that the statue stands 8'.8"  high  and is  2'.8"  sq. at base.Worked in granite in one stone by a Chinese Mason, Lau Kiu, Carver, in the year 1908.

Original manuscript caption:
Hong Kong
Statue of 'Justice' chiselled from one block Hong Kong granite by single Chinese Sculptor copying a cast  from Europe.
The mason [illegible] had a block of granite and the model
he lived slept and contemplated both for one month without touching either then set too [sic] and carved exact facsimile
caption: Statue of Justice, Hong Kong Law Courts

Return to Mrs Huxley.  Loresho. Kabete. Kenya Colony
caption: Sinking an exploratory shaft, Kakamega goldfields

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Dancing at a 'sevusevu' ceremony
Description:
Dancing at a 'sevusevu' ceremony
Two Fijian men perform a dance with fans at a traditional 'sevusevu' welcoming ceremony. They wear ceremonial costume including dramatic face paint, skirts made from strips of fabric and leis made from leaves. Behind them is a traditional wooden ‘tanoa’ (bowl), which is used during the ceremony to mix an infusion of water and powdered kava root (Piper methysticum). Fiji, 1965.
Preparing for the Yanqona ceremony
caption: Dancing at a 'sevusevu' ceremony

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives

Description:
Preparing to drink a kava infusion
A Fijian man prepares to drink an infusion of water and powdered kava root (Piper methysticum) from a 'bilo' (half coconut shell) during a traditional 'sevusevu' welcoming ceremony. Naked from the waist up, he wears ceremonial costume including dramatic face paint and a tiered 'masi' (bark cloth) skirt. Fiji, 1965.
Presentation of the Yanqona cup
caption: Preparing to drink a kava infusion

Aerial view of the famous Koralevu beach hotel - half way between Nadi and Suva. Note the many native "Bures" for visitors.
caption: The Koralevu Beach Hotel, Fiji

Group portrait of a European overseer and African staff of the African Oil Nuts Company sitting beneath the company sign which reads: 'The African Oil Nuts Co. Limited, Central House, Kingsway, London'. Many of the sitters carry the tools of their trade, several miming actions with them. The five men in the foreground display a large flag, which shows the rising sun and the letters 'AON'. 
Marking on reverse: 'A. O. N. Staff, Badagry, May 1922'. Also 1 duplicate.
caption: Group of African Oil Nuts company staff, Badagry

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Portrait photograph of an African bride in traditional dress
Description: Marking on reverse: 'This woman is a chosen bride and in the photo has become such, and is wearing her dancing costume. Note the sunshade on left. She is one of these people who apparently are put into a so-called 'college' to be fattened up and here is where she has just left and become the bride. Certain tribes like their wives fat and Forty!!!!. Ain't she lovely - sweet?'.
caption: Portrait photograph of an African bride in traditional dress

caption: Garden party at Government House

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Nairobi City Hall

Outside the building are a line of flags bearing the Union Jack together with bunting and pennants depicting an ostrich with the words "CITY OF NAIROBI.''  One flag bears the cross of St. Andrew.  Workmen can be seen erecting a flag at the front of the City Hall. and cars line the street outside.
caption: Nairobi City Hall

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives

caption: Mayor and Mayoress of Nairobi await the Royal party

caption: New Stanley Hotel, Nairobi

caption: River running through the grounds of Sagana Lodge

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Press conference at Sagana Lodge to announce the death of King George VI
Description: A group of nine people in a room of the Sagana "Royal" Lodge who are engaged in writing down the news of the death of King George VI.   A man who is standing appears to address the group.  The Royal couple had been due to spend a holiday at the Lodge but left folllowing news of the King's death.
caption: Press conference at Sagana Lodge to announce the death of King George VI

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Sagana Lodge, Nyeri
Description: View across gardens of Sagana Lodge, the "Royal Lodge" presented to Princess Elizabeth who according to Trotter's caption left Kenya without visiting it, although she is believed to in fact have spent one night there. The photograph shows a ground floor timber building with a tiled roof set amongst trees and copious flower boundaries.  A gravel circular drive curves in front of the building.
caption: Sagana Lodge, Nyeri

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Railway track over Maggotty Bridge, Jamaica
Description:
A man operating a hand cart travels across a metal railway bridge, identified as 'Maggotty Bridge', spanning a small river, located on an extension line running between Porus and Montego Bay.
Caption in the negative reads: 79¾ miles. Maggotty Bridge.
caption: Railway track over Maggotty Bridge, Jamaica

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Royal party leaving City Hall
Description: Princess Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh, together with the Mayor and Mayoress of Nairobi, stand on the steps of City Hall as they get ready to leave.  The Princess waves as the whole group looks to its right.  In front of the group stands a mace bearer wearing a military uniform.
caption: Royal party leaving City Hall

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: St Andrew's Church, Nairobi
Description: Front elevation of St Andrew's Church, built to a contemporary design, a former constituent of the Overseas Presbytery of the Church of Scotland until the formation of the Presbyterian Church of East Africa in 1956. A small path leading up to the entrance is bordered by two Union Jack flags.
caption: St Andrew's Church, Nairobi

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Royal party leaving Government House
Description: From underneath the white pillars of Government House, Nairobi, Princess Elizabeth and the Duke of Edinburgh walk away from the reception.  Various uniformed guards stand to attention.
caption: Royal party leaving Government House

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Duke of Edinburgh with Matron, King George VI Hospital
Description: The Duke of Edinburgh, in profile, laughs with a hospital matron during his tour of the hospital.
caption: Duke of Edinburgh with Matron, King George VI Hospital

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Railway viaduct under construction, Jamaica
Description: A railway bridge under construction, spanning the gap across a shallow river bed on the Port Antonio extension.
caption: Railway viaduct under construction, Jamaica

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Princess Elizabeth Hospital for Women, Nairobi
Description: Front elevation of the Princess Elizabeth Hospital for Women. Outside of the building flies a Union Jack flag.
caption: Princess Elizabeth Hospital for Women, Nairobi

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Railway box wagon, Jamaica
Description: A railway box wagon inscribed 'Jamaica Railway 1039', sits on rails at a siding.
caption: Railway box wagon, Jamaica

Title: Railway wagon , Jamaica
Description: A railway wagon inscribed 'J. RY. No.46', sits on rails at a siding.
caption: Railway wagon , Jamaica

Title: Group of Somali men with spears and shields
Description: A group of Somali men advance towards the camera carrying spears and shields. This is similar to another image from 2000/084/1/1/6/5 described as a Bimal war dance, Kismayo.
caption: Group of Somali men with spears and shields

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Portrait of girl from the Mijjerten tribe
Description:
Portrait of a young woman kneeling in front of a screen.The image is from the studios of Foto Parodi, Mogadishu.

Original manuscript caption: Unmarried girl of the Mijjerten tribe.
caption: Portrait of girl from the Mijjerten tribe

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Emir of Katsena standing outside tent
Description: Caption reads: 'Emir of Katsena'. Showing camp and entourage of Muhammad Dikko dan Gidado, Emir of Katsina. Emir is standing outside tent, with mounted and seated retinue. Embossed 'H.S. Freeman, Photographer, Lagos & Districts'.
caption: Emir of Katsena standing outside tent

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View from bungalow at Badagry showing barrels of oil and bags of nuts
Description: Caption reads: 'View from Badagry bungalow window 1922'. Cargo boats wait at a riverside jetty belonging to the African Oil Nuts Company.
caption: View from bungalow at Badagry showing barrels of oil and bags of nuts

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Drawing water from a well
Description: A group of Somali men and women stand around what appears to be a well, as 2 people fill large jars. In a companion photo a camel is sitting next to the well.
caption: Drawing water from a well

Title: District Officer H. Montmorency at Empire Day celebrations
Description:
Caption reads: 'H. Montmorency D.O. Empire Day Badagry 1924'. 
District Officer H. Montmorency attends Empire Day celebrations with his Nigerian assistants or students.
caption: District Officer H. Montmorency at Empire Day celebrations

Title: Group of spectators at Lagos races, Easter 1928
Description: Marking on reverse: 'Lagos races, Easter 1928'. A crowd, predominantly European, at the Easter Races.
caption: Group of spectators at Lagos races, Easter 1928

Description:
Photograph of Sierra Leone Government Railway locomotive no. 23, built by Hunslet Engine Co., Leeds. Engine specifications are handwritten on the photograph.
Caption reads: Standard Type Locomotive.
caption: Sierra Leone Government Railway Locomotive no. 23

Title: Opening ceremony, Sierra Leone Government Railway
Description:
Posed shot of men and women in their finery, gathered for the opening of the Sierra Leone Government Railway line. 
Caption reads: Groupe at Opening of Railway.
caption: Opening ceremony, Sierra Leone Government Railway

Title: 4 Mile Village Railway Station, Sierra Leone
Description:
View of exterior of 4 Mile Village Railway Station under construction (later re-named Newton).
Caption reads: 4 Mile Village Stn. Building, Sep. 1st 1898.
caption: 4 Mile Village Railway Station, Sierra Leone

Title: Opening ceremony, Lagos Steam Tramway
Description: View of train decked with flags and foliage and filled with passengers. They are celebrating the opening of the line.
caption: Opening ceremony, Lagos Steam Tramway

Description:
View showing the curve of the viaduct and a building on the far side. 
Caption reads: Orogon Viaduct, taken from Freetown side, 21st April 1898.
caption: Orogon Viaduct, Sierra Leone

Title: Water Street Station, Sierra Leone
Description:
View of Water Street Station under construction.
Caption reads: S.L.G.Ry. Water St. Station West Elevation, July 3rd 1898.
caption: Water Street Station, Sierra Leone

Title: [Cline Town] Railway Station, Sierra Leone
Description:
View of exterior of [Cline Town] Railway Station.

caption: [Cline Town] Railway Station, Sierra Leone

Title: Waterloo Railway Station, Sierra Leone
Description:
View of exterior of Waterloo Railway Station.
Caption reads: Waterloo Station, 5/11/1898.
caption: Waterloo Railway Station, Sierra Leone

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Preparations for a 'sevusevu' ceremony
Description:
Preparations for a 'sevusevu' ceremony
A group of Fijian men perform an elaborate dance before a traditional 'sevusevu' welcoming ceremony. Most sit cross-legged on the ground, facing each other in two rows, whilst another man dances in the centre, his legs bent and arms outstretched. All wear ceremonial costume including skirts made from palm leaves or strips of fabric. Fiji, 1965.
Preceding any event of importance Yanqona must be prepared with elaborate ceremony.
caption: Preparations for a 'sevusevu' ceremony

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Men perform a 'vakamalolo'
Description:
Men perform a 'vakamalolo'
A group of young Fijian men sit cross-legged in a line and stretch out their arms as they perform a 'vakamalolo' or sitting dance. Naked from the waist up, they wear ceremonial costume including face paint and leis made from leaves. Fiji, 1965.
A Vakamalolo which tells a story of some event of the past
caption: Men perform a 'vakamalolo'

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Waiting for carnival to start, Antigua
Description:
Waiting for the carnival to start. Expectant crowds gather on the main street in St John’s, waiting for a carnival procession to begin. The twin white baroque towers of St John's Cathedral are visible in the distance. St Johns, Antigua, 1965.
Caption reads: THE MAIN STREET IS READY FOR THE PROCESSION
caption: Waiting for carnival to start, Antigua

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Royal Fijian Military Band
Description:
Royal Fijian Military Band
Fronted by a Drum Major holding a staff, the 32-piece Royal Fijian Military Band stands in formation, ready to march. The band's instruments include drums, trombones, tubas and trumpets. Fiji, 1965.
This famous band of the Fijian military forces has toured in many countries throughout the world.
caption: Royal Fijian Military Band

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Sugar cane harvest Barbados
Description:
Sugar cane harvest, Barbados. Three men harvest sugar cane at a plantation, cutting the crop into manageable lengths with a machete before stacking it onto a trailer. Barbados, 1965. 
Caption reads 'SUGAR IS BY FAR THE MOST IMPORTANT INDUSTRY IN BARBADOS'.
caption: Sugar cane harvest Barbados

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A beached boat, Fiji
Description:
A beached boat, Fiji
A small motor boat lies stricken on a sandy beach, after having its “bottom ripped out on a hidden reef". Fiji, 1965.
This boat is unlikely to sail again, for she has just had her bottom ripped out on a hidden reef.
caption: A beached boat, Fiji

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A fisherman's catch at Macau
Description:
A fisherman's catch at Macau
A fisherman's catch is laid out on racks beside sampans moored at Macau Harbour. 
Original Manuscript Caption: A fair catch, the proceeds of which will support a sampan family for a week.
caption: A fisherman's catch at Macau

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A coconut grove on Naviti
Description:
A coconut grove on Naviti
Four men walk along a sandy track through a grove of coconut palms on the volcanic island of Naviti. Naviti, Fiji, 1965.
A sandy track beneath the coconut palms - Naviti
caption: A coconut grove on Naviti

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Banana weighing station, St Lucia
Description:
Banana weighing station, St Lucia
Male and female labourers carry large hands of bananas on their heads at a plantation weighing station. St Lucia, 1965.
caption: Banana weighing station, St Lucia

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Harvesting a cacao pod
Description:
Harvesting a cacao pod
A Grenadian farmer uses a machete to slice a ripe cacao pod from a tree on a cocoa plantation. Grenada, 1965.
caption: Harvesting a cacao pod

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Cape Kidnappers, near Napier, North Island
Description:
Cape Kidnappers, near Napier, North Island
Gannets gather near the shore of Cape Kidnappers as tourists walk towards their Landrover.
Caption reads VISITORS RARELY COME HERE TO CAPE KIDNAPPERS, FOR THOUGH IT IS ONLY ABOUT FIFTEEN MILES FROM NAPIER, THE PLACE IS QUITE INACCESSIBLE WITHOUT A LAND ROVER AND A VERY EXPERIENCED DRIVER.  EVEN THEN A SPECIAL PERMIT FROM THE GOVERNMENT IS NECESSARY.
caption: Cape Kidnappers, near Napier, North Island

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Performers on Moorea Island
Description:
Performers on Moorea Island
A woman holds her hands in the air as she dances on a beach, dressed in a 'pareu' (sarong) and flowered lei. Behind her, several other performers sit in the sand, including four men with traditional Tahitian drums. Moorea Island, Windward Islands, French Polynesia, 1965.
caption: Performers on Moorea Island

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Tasman Glacier Ice Cave, Mount Cook National Park
Description:
Tasman Glacier Ice Cave, Mount Cook National Park
Icicles frame the silhouette of a skier as he surveys an ice cave on the Tasman Glacier, Mount Cook National Park.
Caption reads AN ICE CAVE ON THE TASMAN GLACIER. MOUNT COOK NATIONAL PARK.
caption: Tasman Glacier Ice Cave, Mount Cook National Park

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Aerial view of Auckland Harbour Bridge
Description:
Aerial view of Auckland Harbour Bridge
Auckland Harbour Bridge stretches across Waitemata Harbour towards Auckland city. Auckland, New Zealand, 1966.
Caption reads AN AERIAL VIEW OF AUCKLAND HARBOUR BRIDGE FROM BETWEEN NORTHCOTE AND BIRKENHEAD
caption: Aerial view of Auckland Harbour Bridge

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Seashells for the tourist trade
Description:
Seashells for the tourist trade
A craftsman uses a pointed tool to carve designs onto seashells destined for the tourist trade. Tahiti, French Polynesia, 1965.
The decoration of sea shells is a profitable business.
caption: Seashells for the tourist trade

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Milford Sound from the Milford Hotel
Description:
Milford Sound from the Milford Hotel
A couple admire the view of Milford Sound from the lawn of the Milford Hotel. Southland, New Zealand, 1966.
Caption reads VIEW FROM THE VERANDAH OF THE MILFORD HOTEL. MILFORD SOUND. SOUTHLAND.
caption: Milford Sound from the Milford Hotel

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Trout Fishing at Lake Tarawera, near Rotorua
Description:
Trout Fishing at Lake Tarawera, near Rotorua
A fisherman hooks a trout in a spectacular catch at Lake Tarawera, near Rotorua
Caption reads TROUT FISHING.  LAKE TARAWERA, NEAR ROTORUA
caption: Trout Fishing at Lake Tarawera, near Rotorua

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Returning home, Fiji
Description:
Returning home, Fiji
A line of people return home to their traditional Fijian 'bures' (dwellings), which are set against a rural backdrop of mountains and palm trees. Fiji, 1965.
Returning to their "Bure" after a party
caption: Returning home, Fiji

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Portrait of Salvation Army workers
Description:
Caption reads: 'Some examples of our cook's business photography'. 
Two African men stand on either side of a seated woman holding a bunch of flowers.
caption: Portrait of Salvation Army workers

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Couple seated with their baby quadruplets on a mat in front of them
Description: Also 1 duplicate
caption: Couple seated with their baby quadruplets on a mat in front of them

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Sir Phillip Mitchell with African Chiefs
Description: Photograph depicting the Govenor of Kenya, Sir Phillip Mitchell looking down into the camera at Eastleigh Airport.  He wears spectacles, has a white coloured suit with a sash and a row of medals on the left  of his chest.  On his right are standing a group of elderly African chiefs.
caption: Sir Phillip Mitchell with African Chiefs

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Ancient citadel of Gondershe
Description:
View of the ancient mediaeval citadel of Gondershe on the Somali coast, now in ruins. Photograph is stamped on the back with the mark of Foto Parodi.

Original manuscript caption: Gezirat al Gondersheik
18 kms from Mogadishu
[crossed out] Isola di Gesira
caption: Ancient citadel of Gondershe

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: "Laconia Special" steam locomotive
Description:
A steam train sits at a siding by the roadside in Kenya. There are railway workers and cars, probably taxis, lining the road and platform. The train is described as the "Laconia Special", presumably carrying ship's passengers.

Original manuscript caption: Laconia Special

Later manuscript caption: Mombasa
caption: "Laconia Special" steam locomotive

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Construction of the Princess Elizabeth Highway
Description: A group of construction workers stand in the foreground with a lorry marked 'East African Enterprise Ltd.'  The newly constructed road stretches ahead with banners lining the sides and Union Jack bunting overhead.
caption: Construction of the Princess Elizabeth Highway

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Unloading locomotive from SS Harmonides
Description: Overhead view of the cranes onboard SS Harmonides lowering a locomotive boiler onto the dockside railway at Kilindini harbour, where a tender already stands. Workmen are standing nearby. Part of a series showing the locomotive's unloading.
caption: Unloading locomotive from SS Harmonides

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Unloading locomotive tender from the SS Harmonides
Description: A locomotive tender being lifted by onboard crane from the SS Harmonides at Kilindini Harbour, Mombasa. Workmen are standing nearby. Part of a series showing the locomotive's unloading.
caption: Unloading locomotive tender from the SS Harmonides

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Leaving the airport
Description: Princess Elizabeth and The Duke of Edinburgh drive away from Eastleigh Airport in a car bearing the Royal insignia.  Behind this car drives another car also bearing the Royal crest.  An African police officer points in the direction of travel.
caption: Leaving the airport

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Bow end of SS Modasa at Mombasa Docks
Description: View from the bow end of the SS Modasa showing bags of cargo being offloaded at Kilindini Harbour. Workmen are standing nearby. Companion image to 1999/135/1/1/6.
caption: Bow end of SS Modasa at Mombasa Docks

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Somali women performing a dance
Description:
A group of Somali women perform a song and dance. 

Original manuscript caption: A women's song and dance, paraffin tins as drums.
caption: Somali women performing a dance

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Lighthouse, Mombasa
Description:
View of lighthouse and radio transmission installation at Ras Serani, also showing telegraph pole and wires. 

Later manuscript caption: lighthouse at Mombasa
caption: Lighthouse, Mombasa

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Extension work at Port of Spain railway station, Trinidad
Description:
A third class railway station building is removed during extension work at the Trinidad Government Railway terminus in Port of Spain.
Caption reads: No.152  Port-of-Spain Extensions, Removal of 3rd class Station  10.6.14
caption: Extension work at Port of Spain railway station, Trinidad

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Street scene, Kingston, Jamaica
Description: Street scene showing a sign that reads: 'Cars will not stop between North St. and Drummond St. on the up trip. By order'; possibly an instruction to accommodate the city's trams at Kingston.
caption: Street scene, Kingston, Jamaica

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Railway viaduct, Jamaica
Description: Two men stand barefoot on a newly completed trestle bridge built across a steep valley. The bridge was one of several viaducts constructed to carry new railway lines, on the Port Antonio extension.
caption: Railway viaduct, Jamaica

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Nicol Brook Viaduct, Sierra Leone
Description:
View of Nicol Brook Viaduct during its construction taken from the Songo Town side.
Caption reads: Nicol Brook Viaduct from Songo Town side
caption: Nicol Brook Viaduct, Sierra Leone

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Maroon Viaduct, Sierra Leone

Caption reads: No. 67 Maroon Viaduct shewing the Freetown abutment. Nov. 6 97
caption: Maroon Viaduct, Sierra Leone

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives

Local railway workers waiting for their pay outside the Pay Office.
Caption reads: Saturday's Pay Day at Depot
caption: Pay day for railway workers

Title: Tram lines, Kingston, Jamaica
Description: Rails laid down for mule-drawn trams criss-cross a road bridge flanked by telegraph poles at Kingston.

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Hastings Viaduct, Sierra Leone
Description: Hastings Viaduct under construction. Caption reads: Hastings Viaduct from Songo side. 9 Oct. 97
caption: Hastings Viaduct, Sierra Leone

Title: Railway wagon , Jamaica
Description: A closed railway wagon inscribed 'J. RY. 2004', sits on rails at a siding.

Description: Jamaica Railway sidings leading up to a railway shed.
caption: Railway sidings, Jamaica

Title: Government House, St Vincent
Description: View of Government House with union flag flying. Taken by Norton Bros and Co. Caption reads: 'Government House, St Vincent'
caption: Government House, St Vincent

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: King Street, Kingston, Jamaica
Description: Crowded street scene taken from above. Similar view to 2005/001/151/5. Caption reads: 'King Street, Kingston'

Title: Marine Gardens, Kingston, Jamaica
Description:
Interior of gardens with posed figures.

Title: Fruit carriers

Men and women carrying bananas.
Caption reads: 'Fruit carriers'
caption: Fruit carriers

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Hong Kong Harbour
Description:
View over Hong Kong harbour looking across to Kowloon; an area known today as 'Admiralty'. Numerous vessels float in the harbour, including the triple-masted HMS Tamar, steamships, launches and Chinese junks. 

Original manuscript caption: "No. 7 Hong Kong    1903    Hong Kong Harbour and Kowloon from Hong Kong Island .  Harbour 1 1/2  -  2 miles across. Kowloon side- on left of picture jetties where ocean steamers go along side- all P&O steamers berth here.
On right of picture the Kowloon docks and ship building work- all Admiralty vessels docked here up to now- but now Admiralty dock building on Hong Kong Island.
Hong Kong side- on left of picture Hong Kong Club (the hotel is about 1/4 mile from this) then Navy yard - ordnance stores etc.
Harbour- the Roofed in ship with 3 masts in harbour is the HMS Tamar- the depot stop
all round this are the moorings for the fleet- but in this view- the fleet are conspicous by their absence, there not being more than half a dozen here
Note the large number of launches- all with white awnings on top
on entrance right of picture two small junks lying together."
caption: Hong Kong Harbour

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Central and Western parts of Hong Kong Harbour
Description:
View over the central and western front of Hong Kong harbour, looking north towards Kowloon.

Original manuscript caption: "No. 10 Hong Kong    1903  The central and western part of harbour from Hong Kong.  Note Kowloon in distance.  Place the left hand edge of No 8  [1998/028/2/6]  close to right hand edge of this picture - and the view of the harbour is almost continuous. Note right hand corner close to water a large square building, the HK Hotel
This view shows about 1/3-1/2 of the city of Victoria.
This view looks almost directly North- with Kowloon in distance
The houses at R hand bottom corner are in Queens gardens- and the photographer stands alone half way up the hill- note from this distance (about 2 miles) the numerous  large steamers moored in harbour- and remember that this is by no means as full as it often is- and also remember that you can only look at about half the area of the harbour- the mooring for all ships was beginning beyond the right hand edge of the photograph."
caption: Central and Western parts of Hong Kong Harbour

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Queens Road Central, Hong Kong
Description:
Rickshaws, pedestrians and street traders bustle about on Queen's Road Central. The Pedder Street clock tower, demolished in 1908, is visible in the distance; an original caption comments that it is covered 'with bamboo scaffolding for repairs'. 

Original manuscript caption: "No.2 Hong Kong April 1903 -    Queens Road Central looking East...Note Blake Clock Tower on left with Bamboo scaffolding for repairs.  Coolie in centre of road carrying two baskets on bamboo over shoulder - typical fashion.  Note large gutters by side of road for heavy rain and on left hand side wooden platform necessary to step over gutters.This street too narrow for traffic only about 20 yards wide & often traffic congested."
caption: Queens Road Central, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Part of Peak District, Hong Kong
Description:
View of Victoria Peak, the highest mountain on Hong Kong Island, showing the Governor's summer residence, hotels and various grand buildings.

Original manuscript caption: "No. 4 Hong Kong 1903   View of  part of Peak District Victoria Gap.  Down below on right is Peak Hotel  -  Immediately above this [not in picture] is Peak Hospital...  Above and to left of Hotel are Summer Barrack quarter [European].  Above these in gaps is Governor's Summer Residence.  On right hand Peak is Flagstaff, from which mail boats are seen and signalled 30 miles out at sea.  Elevation 1,700ft.  White foreground is hill pathway."
caption: Part of Peak District, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Junction of Queen's Road and Jervois Street, Hong Kong
Description:
Street traders sell their wares to passers-by at the junction of Queen's Road and Jervois Street, Hong Kong. Multi-storey buildings flank the road, covered with vertical signs that advertise goods and services in Chinese script.

Original manuscript caption: Hong Kong - Junction of Queen's Road & Jervois Street.
caption: Junction of Queen's Road and Jervois Street, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Bulls laden with pine branches
Description:
Two harnessed bulls stand in the street, laden with huge bundles of dried pine branches to be used for fuel. Their masters stand nearby, wearing large, conical hats that extend to their shoulders. 

Original manuscript caption: Seoul - Black bull with load of dried pine branches for fuel.  Drivers with large hats and long pipes.
caption: Bulls laden with pine branches

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Avenue of statues leading to the Ming Dynasty tombs
Description:
An avenue of ancient statues guides the way to the Ming Dynasty tombs, a burial ground containing the mausoleums of 13 Emperors of the Chinese Ming Dynasty (1368-1644). 

Original manuscript caption: Avenue to Ming Tombs- 30 miles north west of Peking.
caption: Avenue of statues leading to the Ming Dynasty tombs

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Hong Kong's Victoria Harbour, 1903
Description:
View of Victoria Harbour taken from Hong Kong Island overlooking the Kowloon peninsula. A variety of vessels are visible, ranging from British naval ships to Chinese sampans.

Original manuscript caption: Hong Kong. Eastern end of Harbour from Bowen Road.
caption: Hong Kong's Victoria Harbour, 1903

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Residential area on Hong Kong Island
Description:
A view of Hong Kong, taken from Bowen Road, features a European residential quarter filled with large, multi-storey colonial houses.

Original manuscript caption: Hong Kong. European Residential Quarter - View from Bowen Road.
caption: Residential area on Hong Kong Island

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Cantonese seal carvers
Description:
A number of Cantonese seal carvers sit at their stalls, waiting for passing business at the side of a city street. 

Original manuscript caption: Chip and Seal Cutters. Canton
caption: Cantonese seal carvers

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Petty criminals in the stocks, Hong Kong
Description:
Two petty criminals sit with their ankles restrained in stocks, suffering public humiliation on a city street. Each wears a board strung around his neck, describing in detail the offense committed. 

Original manuscript caption: Prisoners in stocks. - generally for six hours at a stretch. Very uncomfortable if feet higher than level of ground sat upon. Their misdemeanor depicted on board.
caption: Petty criminals in the stocks, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Inside a Chinese barber's shop
Description:
Two men with distinctive Manchu hairstyles receive treatment at a barber's shop. One sits with his long hair thrown forward whilst a barber shaves the back of his head; the other tilts his head to have his ears cleaned. Several false 'queues' (waist-long pigtails), hang on the wall behind them; an equivalent to modern-day hair extensions. 

Original manuscript caption: Barber
caption: Inside a Chinese barber's shop

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: European man with two geisha and their 'okaa-san'
Description:
A European man poses outside a Japanese tea house with two female geisha and their 'okaa-san' (the female manager of a geisha house). The girls wear traditional kimonos and their hair is worn up in 'shimada' style. 

Original manuscript caption: Moji - Tea House girls and Mamma, & "our allies".
caption: European man with two geisha and their 'okaa-san'

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Korean women in traditional 'hanbok' dress
Description:
A group of Korean women and girls sit in the grounds of an imperial palace in Seoul. All wear traditional 'hanbok' dress, comprising full-length skirts and wide-sleeved, hip-length jackets or shirts. 

Original manuscript caption: Seoul - Girls and Women in grounds of Imperial Palace.
caption: Korean women in traditional 'hanbok' dress

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Statue of an elephant at the Ming Dynasty tombs
Description: A European man poses beside the statue of an elephant, one of several ancient stone statues guiding the way to the Ming Dynasty tombs. The site contains the mausoleums of 13 Emperors of the Chinese Ming Dynasty (1368-1644). Near Peking (Beijing).
caption: Statue of an elephant at the Ming Dynasty tombs

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Houseboats at Wuchow
Description:
Several houseboats are moored along the banks of the Xijiang River at Wuchow (Wuzhou). A number of roughly-built houses comprise a shanty town leading down to the water's edge in the distance. 

Original manuscript caption: Wuchow. Kwang-Si Province. West River - 250 miles from Hong Kong
caption: Houseboats at Wuchow

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Peep boxes at a Chinese fair
Description:
Stallholders set up peep boxes beneath parasols at an outdoor fair. Each box was constructed with several small doors, that when opened, would reveal a unique miniature scene within. Probably China.

Original manuscript caption: Peep Shows
caption: Peep boxes at a Chinese fair

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Flying a dragon kite
Description:
A long kite, constructed in segments to look like a dragon, is made ready to fly. A group of spectators gather to watch, sheltering from the sun beneath parasols.

Original manuscript caption: Dragon Kite
caption: Flying a dragon kite

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Deities inside a Chinese Joss house
Description:
Statues of Chinese deities ('Joss') line the walls inside a Joss house (Chinese temple). 

Original manuscript caption: Interior of Joss House, Santan Island (British) near Hong Kong
caption: Deities inside a Chinese Joss house

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Women and children posed outside thatched hut
Description: Women and children posed outside thatched hut, showing servants in their domestic setting. Caption reads: 'House Women'
caption: Women and children posed outside thatched hut

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Posed studio shot of local woman
Description: Posed studio shot of local woman with painted backdrop. No caption.
caption: Posed studio shot of local woman

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Mount Langton, Bermuda
Description: Showing house set among trees. Numbered 10 in a series. Caption reads: 'Mount Langton'
caption: Mount Langton, Bermuda

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Mango tree
Description: Showing tree in fruit with seat and two figures. Caption reads: 'Mango Tree'
caption: Mango tree

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Palm trees
Description: Palm trees line a road. Caption reads: 'Palms'
caption: Palm trees

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Second Devonshire Regiment of the British Army, led by Captain Davies
Description:
The Second Devonshire Regiment of the British Army, led by Captain Davies, poses for a group portrait in front of Wuntho Palace and the town's 'Pon-gyi kyaunga' (Buddhist monastery). The group are pictured shortly after British forces captured Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'The Company Devon Regiment (Halting). 406'
caption: The Second Devonshire Regiment of the British Army, led by Captain Davies

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Practising a shooting stance
Description:
Practising a shooting stance
Turbaned Indian Military and Civil Police officers practice their shooting stances on the outskirts of Wuntho, crouched down on one knee, their rifles at the ready. These forces supported the British Army in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (Sagaing Division). Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Military & Civil police Skirmishing. No.444'
caption: Practising a shooting stance

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Village at the Morgandine Pass
Description:
Village at the Morgandine Pass
Armed British and Indian soldiers pose beside a bullock-drawn cart in a village at the Morgandine Pass. Possibly a mix of British Army and Military Police officers, the men were involved in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (today known as the Sagaing Division). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Village in the Morgandine Pass. No.437'
caption: Village at the Morgandine Pass

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Wuntho Palace and the 'Pon-gyi kyaung'
Description:
Wuntho Palace and the 'Pon-gyi kyaung'
British Army soldiers pose in front of Wuntho Palace (left) and the town's 'Pon-gyi kyaung' (Buddhist monastery). The group are pictured shortly after British forces captured Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'The Palace & Phongyu Kyaung. No.418'
caption: Wuntho Palace and the 'Pon-gyi kyaung'

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Royal Artillery at Wuntho
Description:
The Royal Artillery at Wuntho
British and Indian soldiers in the Second Mountain Battery of the Royal Artillery pose with two artillery guns in front of Wuntho Palace. The group are pictured shortly after British forces captured Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: '2nd. Mountain Battery R.A. at Wuntho. No.415'
caption: The Royal Artillery at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Arrival of Commissariat carts
Description:
Arrival of Commissariat carts
Bullock-drawn Commissariat carts laden with food and provisions arrive at Wuntho. The supplies were intended for British Army troops who had recently captured the town following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Arrival of Commissariat carts at Wuntho. No.416'
caption: Arrival of Commissariat carts

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Wolseley and Smyth at Wuntho
Description:
Wolseley and Smyth at Wuntho
Horses ridden by General Wolseley and Major Smyth drink from a shallow river that flows beneath a bridge. Both officers led British Army troops against Burmese rebels during a conflict at Wuntho. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Bridge at Wuntho, Genl. Wolseley and Major Smyth. No.421'
caption: Wolseley and Smyth at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Group of men in civilian clothes pose against a wall
Description: Group of men in civilian clothes pose against a wall. Names are given: Lt Hall, Lt Little, Lt Nash, Lt Davies, Lt Jones, Major Davis, [Dr?] Barry. Also dogs Toby and Vixen.
caption: Group of men in civilian clothes pose against a wall

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Group of men in civilian clothes pose by cannon
Description: Men in civilian clothes pose by cannon. Names are given: Lt Hall, Lt Little, Dr O'Donovan, Col Dixon, Major Davis, Lt Nash, Lt Davies.
caption: Group of men in civilian clothes pose by cannon

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Morgandine Pass
Description:
The Morgandine Pass
A covered cart pulled by bullocks makes its way along a rough track at the Morgandine Pass. Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
Caption reads: 'The Morgandine Pass, No. 404'
caption: The Morgandine Pass

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Welcome arch for the Duke of Connaught, Hong Kong
Description:
A decorative welcome arch spans a city street in honour of the Duke of Connaught, who visited Hong Kong shortly before a devastating typhoon struck the city on 18 September. 

Original manuscript caption: High dignitaries in the these Celestial regions must always pass under such arches which indicate high rank. These arches are quite temporary but beautifully set up.
caption: Welcome arch for the Duke of Connaught, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Oxfordshire Light Infantry at Wuntho
Description:
The Oxfordshire Light Infantry at Wuntho
British Army officers from the Oxfordshire Light Infantry pose outside Wuntho Palace and the town's 'Pon-gyi kyaunga' (Buddhist monastery). The group are pictured shortly after British forces captured Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Phongyi Kyaung at Wuntho Quarter of the Oxford L.I. under Comd. of Capt. O'Dell. No.447'
caption: The Oxfordshire Light Infantry at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: An outdoor bazaar at Wuntho
Description:
An outdoor bazaar at Wuntho
A line of women and children sell food from baskets on the ground outside a British Army military camp. The tents in the background were erected during a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (today known as the Sagaing Division). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Baazar at Wuntho. No.424'
caption: An outdoor bazaar at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Welcome arch for the Duke of Connaught, Hong Kong
Description:
A decorative welcome arch spans a city street in honour of the Duke of Connaught, who visited Hong Kong shortly before a devastating typhoon struck the city on 18 September. 

Original manuscript caption: Chinese Triumphal Arch in honour of Prince Arthur.
caption: Welcome arch for the Duke of Connaught, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Great Wall of China at Nankou Pass
Description:
View of the Great Wall of China, taken at Nankou Pass in the mountains of Manchuria. Built between 1560 and 1640 during the Chinese Ming Dynasty (1368-1644), the wall stretches for a distance of 6,352 kilometres (3,948 miles). 

Original manuscript caption: Great Wall of China - Nankou Pass
caption: The Great Wall of China at Nankou Pass

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The road into Youngma
Description:
The road into Youngma
The road leading into Youngma, lined with carved stone 'zeidis' or pagodas. This scene was captured during the British campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (Sagaing Division). Youngma, Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
Caption reads: 'View of Youngma. No.434'
caption: The road into Youngma

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Temple of 500 Genii, Canton
Description:
Interior view of the Buddhist Temple of 500 Genii. The statues of genii that line the walls represent the 500 disciples of Buddha who supposedly founded the temple in around 500AD. 

Original manuscript caption: Temple of 500 Genii, Canton
caption: The Temple of 500 Genii, Canton

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Ornate entrance to a Hong Kong Joss house
Description:
An ornate, pagoda-style roof, adorned with religious idols, decorates the doorway at the entrance to a 'Joss house'. 

Original manuscript caption: Joss House - specialty in roofs.
caption: Ornate entrance to a Hong Kong Joss house

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Three Burmese girls at Wuntho
Description:
Three Burmese girls at Wuntho
Three young Burmese girls pose outside a thatched dwelling, balancing baskets of ripe bananas on their heads. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
Caption reads: 'The three Graces, at Wuntho. No. 456'
caption: Three Burmese girls at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Junks moored at a Hong Kong harbour
Description:
Two Chinese junks are moored at a Hong Kong harbour with their rudders raised up out of the water. 

Original manuscript caption: Junks
Rudder hauled out of water while at anchor.
caption: Junks moored at a Hong Kong harbour

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: House of Mourning
Description:
A view down an alley in a residential area in Canton, showing a house in mourning. Traditional Chinese custom dictates that when a member of the family passes, a period of mourning has to be observed for up to 100 days, whereupon items are left outside the home to show they are in mourning, or to guide the soul of the deceased back to the house on the seventh day after death. 

Original manuscript caption: House of Mourning, Canton
caption: House of Mourning

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Watering the roadway
Description:
A man throws water from a bucket onto the road, probably to control surface dust. Behind him, to the left, is the London Mission building, Peking.

Original manuscript caption: Watering the roadway - London Mission Building to left.

The London Mission Building in Beijing was largely destroyed in 1900 so the location of this photo is a mystery as the page to which it is fixed is headed "Peking".
caption: Watering the roadway

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Blake Clock Tower, Hong Kong
Description:
View over Hong Kong looking south, featuring a prominent clock tower, possibly the Pedder Street clock tower, in the foreground. 

Original manuscript caption: View from my balcony looking south. Blake Clock Tower, R.C. Cathedral, Flag staff on highest point of Peak over Clock Tower not come out in photo.
caption: Blake Clock Tower, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: At a station on the Peking to Hankow railway line
Description:
A crowd of people at a railway station on the Peking (Beijing) to Hankow (Hankou) railway line. The man in uniform on the left is possibly a station official.

Original manuscript caption: Peking - Hankow Railway -Station Crowd.
caption: At a station on the Peking to Hankow railway line

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Handcart on a harbourside road in Seoul
Description:
A man pushes a handcart laden with luggage along a harbourside road in Seoul. Two women in traditional Korean dress hitch a ride on the front. 

Original manuscript caption: Seoul, Korea - Street Scene
caption: Handcart on a harbourside road in Seoul

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Boats on the Xijiang River at Sam Shui
Description:
A sampan travels along the Xijiang River at Sam Shui, passing a string of boats moored along the riverbank.

Original manuscript caption: Sam Shui.  West River. 90 miles from Canton, now connected by railway.
caption: Boats on the Xijiang River at Sam Shui

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Joss house in Shau Kei Wan
Description:
Exterior view of a small Joss house (Chinese temple) in Shau Kei Wan. Illustrated panels decorate the eaves beneath the building's ornate roof.

Original manuscript caption: New Joss House. Shau-Ki Wan. Hong Kong
caption: Joss house in Shau Kei Wan

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Harvesting rice by hand
Description:
Farm workers harvest a rice crop by hand, gathering the cut grass into sheaves before depositing it into tall, wicker baskets. 

Original manuscript caption: Rice Harvest (Paddy) New Territory
caption: Harvesting rice by hand

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Major Branding's orderly
Description:
African man standing next to horse with nosebag

Original manuscript caption: Major Branding's orderly
caption: Major Branding's orderly

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Police on transfer
Description:
Crowd of men under a ship's awning

Original manuscript caption: Police on transfer
caption: Police on transfer

Title: Troops on a troop ship, Anglo-Somali War
Description:
Crowds of men on a ship

Original manuscript caption: Troops on a troop ship
caption: Troops on a troop ship, Anglo-Somali War

Title: Kenyan shamba
Description:
Man (probably Frank Elliott) with hands in pockets standing in cultivated land

Original manuscript caption: A bit of my shamba at Nairobi

Title: Entering harbour at Port Said
Description:
View of Port Said from the deck of a ship

Original manuscript caption: Entering Port Said Harbour
caption: Entering harbour at Port Said

Title: Mr. Ewart A.D.S.P.
Description:
Man standing in garden and facing camera

Original manuscript caption: Mr. Ewart A.D.S.P.

Description:
Seated woman with man standing at side and dog in foreground

Title: View of Port Said
Description:
View of Port Said from the deck of a ship

Original manuscript caption: Off Port Said

Title: A view of Suez
Description:
Steam ship on the Suez Canal

Original manuscript caption: A view of Suez
caption: A view of Suez

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Rhino feeding
Description:
View of open land with trees

Original manuscript caption: Rhino feeding
caption: Rhino feeding

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A fort at Aden
Description:
View of a hill fort

Original manuscript caption: A fort at Aden
caption: A fort at Aden

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Suez
Description:
View of buildings seen across the Suez canal

Original manuscript caption: Suez
caption: Suez

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Police office Mombasa
Description:
Single storey building with European man in foreground

Original manuscript caption: The Police office Mombasa
caption: The Police office Mombasa

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Jandri Ghat, Dalhousie
Description:
Exterior view of the gardens and buildings of Jandri Ghat, Dalhousie, built in 1870-71 as a residence of the Kings of Chamba. There are European guests on horseback and Indians standing in the gardens. Winthrop and Maclagan's party stayed here on the night of the 28th April on the way back from Chamba to Lahore.

Original manuscript caption: Leaving Jandrighat
caption: Jandri Ghat, Dalhousie

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of central Darjeeling
Description:
View of Darjeeling looking towards the bandstand and 'chowrasta', the equivalent of a town square on the ridge of the town itself. The scene shows a busy time of day, with Europeans and Indians standing, seated and on horseback.

Printed caption: No. 10. THE CHOWRASTA
TH. PAAR. DARJEELING

Original manuscript caption: Darjeeling
caption: View of central Darjeeling

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: State band and troops, Chamba
Description:
View of the hills and buildings of Chamba in the distance, with the state band and troops massed for a parade on grassy open space in the foreground. The parade was presumably connected with the installation of the Raja.

Original manuscript caption: Chamba State Band & troops
caption: State band and troops, Chamba

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: British government officers arrive in Chamba
Description:
Four British government officers, accompanied by an escort of Indian guards, ride on horseback through a decorated stone arch upon arrival in Chamba for the installation of the Raja. 

Original manuscript caption: Arrival in Chamba
caption: British government officers arrive in Chamba

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Victoria Memorial from across the Hooghly River
Description: View of the exterior of the Victoria Memorial taken from the far bank of the Hooghly River. There are several Indian men standing in the foreground. It is possible that landscaping work is still ongoing.
caption: Victoria Memorial from across the Hooghly River

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of Darjeeling
Description:
View looking down on Darjeeling taken from Auckland Road, showing churches, houses, and people standing in open spaces.

Printed caption: No.8 VIEW FROM AUKLAND [sic] ROAD
TH. PAAR. DARJEELING

Original manuscript caption: View from Auckland Road
Darjeeling
caption: View of Darjeeling

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of Mussoorie after a hail storm
Description:
View looking down over mountain top buildings of Mussoorie after a hailstorm on Easter Day, 1905. 

Original manuscript caption: View of ... end of Mussorie [sic]
after hail-storm Easter Day 1905
caption: View of Mussoorie after a hail storm

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of the Himalayas from Mussoorie
Description:
View of snow capped peaks in the Himalayas, taken from Mussoorie.

Printed caption: T.A. Rust

Original manuscript caption: View of the Snowy Range
from Mussoorie
caption: View of the Himalayas from Mussoorie

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Charminar, Hyderabad
Description:
Pedestrians line a street running towards the Charminar in Hyderabad, a monument and mosque constructed in 1591.

Caption on reverse: Char Minara
Rs 2/-

Original manuscript caption: Char Minar
caption: The Charminar, Hyderabad

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Portrait of a colonial gentleman, India
Description: Portrait of a British man seated on a wicker chair, holding a pith helmet.
caption: Portrait of a colonial gentleman, India

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Sir Edward Maclagan and the Raja of Suket
Description:
Sir Edward Maclagan, Lieutenant Governor of the Punjab (centre), stands on a verandah in the company of several British officials and the Raja of Suket. Winthrop's diary describes the visit as comprising an Investiture and State Banquet.

Original manuscript caption:  SUKET   28/3 to 1/4 1920
H.E.W.  Parsons    H.H.  French   Burlton    Raja    Sandford    A.D.C.  Suket
caption: Sir Edward Maclagan and the Raja of Suket

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Winthrop with friends, Abazai
Description:
Group shot of Winthrop with friends at a bathing picnic, Abazai. Most of the group are named underneath the photo.

Original manuscript caption: Bampton D.F. Mrs Lowe E.F. H.E.W. Guise
? C.O.H.
caption: Winthrop with friends, Abazai

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Victoria Bridge in Mandi, India

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Disembarking from the S.S. Balmoral Castle
Description:
The Duke and Duchess of Connaught and their daughter, Princess Patricia, disembark from the S.S. Balmoral Castle on their arrival in St Helena. This was one of several stops made by the royal couple on their way to Cape Town. 25 October 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit: 
Monday, October 24. 
10 A.M. Saint Helena. Governor's Representative will call.
11 A.M. to 12.30 P.M. Land and receive Address, Visit to Castle, Lace School and Hospital.
Lunch on board (private)
2.15 P.M. to 6 P.M. Visit to Longwood.
Dinner, "Balmoral Castle".
caption: Disembarking from the S.S. Balmoral Castle

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Duke of Connaught in St Helena
Description:
The Duke and Duchess of Connaught assemble for a photograph with European dignitaries outside Government House. This was one of several stops made by the royal couple on their way to Cape Town. St Helena, 25 October 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Tuesday, October 25
12 noon. Saint Helena, Land.
1.30 P.M. Lunch at Government House.
3.15 P.M.Garden Party at Government House
5 P.M. Return on board
6.15 P.M. Leave for Cape Town
caption: Duke of Connaught in St Helena

Title: Capture of Kyaing-Kwintaung
Description:
Capture of Kyaing-Kwintaung
Soldiers of the Second Devonshire Regiment, led by General Wolseley, aim rifles as they [re-enact?] their successful capture of the Kyaing-Kwintaung stockade. The stronghold was seized from the Saopha of Wuntho and his rebel supporters, who opposed British attempts to annex areas of Burma (Myanmar). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Interior of Kyaing Kwintaung Stockade after Capture the Devon Regt. Firing on the Retreating Enemy.  no.409'
caption: Capture of Kyaing-Kwintaung

Title: The palace at Wuntho
Description:
The palace at Wuntho
Side view of Wuntho Palace, raised off the ground on wooden stilts and distinguished by its pagoda-style roof. This scene was captured shortly after British forces took control of the town following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'The Palace at Wuntho, now used as Head Quarters Staff. No.417'
caption: The palace at Wuntho
