caption: The Durbar, Chamba

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Roadside stall at Mussoorie bazaar
Description:
An Indian man sits hunched up on a roadside stall in a bazaar at Mussoorie. He appears to be a haberdasher, selling items including scissors and dress-making patterns.

Printed number: 30

Original manuscript caption: Shop in bazaar Mussoorie
caption: Roadside stall at Mussoorie bazaar

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: 'Water mule', India
Description:
A man crouches down to take water from a large leather water sack slung across the back of a mule. 

Original manuscript caption: Water-Mule
caption: 'Water mule', India

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Portrait of an Indian water carrier
Description:
Portrait of an Indian man transporting water in clay pots tied to either end of a long pole carried over his shoulder.

Original manuscript caption: Water-carrier
caption: Portrait of an Indian water carrier

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Dhurumtollah Street, Kolkata
Description:
View of Dhurumtollah Street taken from a balcony. The decorative domes of a mosque can be seen on the left.

Original manuscript caption: Street Dhurumtollah Calcutta
caption: Dhurumtollah Street, Kolkata

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Hooghly River, West Bengal
Description:
A lone fishing boat rests on the calm waters of the Hooghly River.

Original manuscript caption: View on the Hooghly
caption: Hooghly River, West Bengal

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Darjeeling Hill Railway, near Sookna
Description:
A steam engine approaches through an avenue of trees. The stretch of line is part of the Darjeeling Hill Railway near Sookna, West Bengal.

Printed caption: No. 39. AVENUE NEAR SOOKNA
TH. PAAR. DARJEELING


Original manuscript caption: Avenue near Sookna
Darjeeling Railway
caption: Darjeeling Hill Railway, near Sookna

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: 'The wheel of existence'
Description:
Close-up shot of a 'wheel of existence' painting. In the dharmic religions (Hinduism, Buddhism and Jainism), the wheel, sometimes known as the 'wheel of life', is a mandala or symbolic representation of samsara, the continuous cycle of birth, life and death.

Printed caption: No. 32. WHEEL .of. EXISTENCE
TH. PAAR. 

Original manuscript caption: The Wheel of Existence
caption: 'The wheel of existence'

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Roadside conversation, Mussoorie
Description:
Two men chat on a roadside surrounded by tall trees at a mountain hill station. 

Printed caption: Rust

Original manuscript caption: Road in Mussoorie
caption: Roadside conversation, Mussoorie

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Side elevation of the Victoria Memorial during construction
Description: View of the side elevation of the Victoria Memorial during construction. A number of Indian men, possibly workers, are in the foreground.
caption: Side elevation of the Victoria Memorial during construction

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Colonial house, India
Description: View of the open verandah of a brick house, with steps leading down to an expanse of grass.
caption: Colonial house, India

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: New Zealand Missionary Church, India
Description:
View of a small church with steeple, reflected in an expanse of water.

Caption on reverse: New Zealand Missionary Church
caption: New Zealand Missionary Church, India

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The British Residency, Hyderabad
Description: Exterior view of the British Residency, Hyderabad, showing the front elevation and steps leading down to gardens laid out with a fountain.
caption: The British Residency, Hyderabad

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Bank of Bengal, Chandpur
Description:
Exterior view of the Bank of Bengal building in Chandpur. Indian officials stand on the verandah next to steps leading down to the water. The same building is pictured in 2003/071/1/1/3/58.

Caption on reverse: The Bank Chandpur
caption: Bank of Bengal, Chandpur

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Orderlies' Quarters, India
Description:
View of low buildings with corrugated iron roofs, surrounded by water. Two men, described as cooks, are standing outside. Probably the servants' quarters for the Bank of Bengal in Chandpur.

Caption on reverse: Cooks - Cook house & chuprassies [orderlies] quarters
caption: Orderlies' Quarters, India

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Durbar procession, India
Description: Europeans line the upper balconies of a city street to watch the Langar procession, a traditional parade once held annually in Hyderabad immediately preceding the period of mourning associated with the month of Muharram. A large copy of the same image is at 2003/071/1/1/3/77. The photo is mounted and enclosed within a cover which carries the manuscript annotation "With best wishes, from Lalat Jung."
caption: Durbar procession, India

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View across the lake at Kandy
Description:
View from a high vantage point across the lake at Kandy. 

Original manuscript caption: Kandy Lake Ceylon
caption: View across the lake at Kandy

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Sittwe, Myanmar
Description:
View of a narrow road with farmland and single-storey houses stretching into the distance.

Original manuscript caption: Akyab from The Point
continued
caption: Sittwe, Myanmar

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Near 'The Point', Myanmar
Description:
A rough track runs from 'The Point', a projecting spit of land in Sittwe, towards houses on the coast. 

Original manuscript caption: Akyab from the Point continued
caption: Near 'The Point', Myanmar

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Cashmere (Kashmiri) Gate, Delhi
Description:
View of the Cashmere (Kashmir) Gate, the scene of a battle between British troops and Indian sepoys during the Indian Rebellion (1857-58). 

Original manuscript caption: The Cashmere Gate Delhi
caption: Cashmere (Kashmiri) Gate, Delhi

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Qutb Minar
Description:
View of the Qutb Minar, one of the greatest monuments of Islamic architecture in India. At 72.5 metres tall, the celebratory victory tower was built to accompany the Quwwat-ul-Islam mosque, and was probably inspired by the style of Afghan minarets. 

Original manuscript caption:The Kutub near Delhi
caption: The Qutb Minar

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Qutb Minar
Description:
View of the Qutb Minar, one of the greatest monuments of Islamic architecture in India. At 72.5 metres tall, the celebratory victory tower was built to accompany the Quwwat-ul-Islam mosque, and was probably inspired by the style of Afghan minarets. 

Original manuscript caption: The Kutub near Delhi
caption: The Qutb Minar

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Iron Pillar at Qutb
Description:
The Iron Pillar stands before the ruins of Quwwat-ul-Islam Mosque. Like the nearby Ashoka Pillar ('Singh Stambh'), with which it is often confused, the Iron Pillar was erected in around 400AD and has remained mysteriously uncorroded for hundreds of years. 

Original manuscript caption: Arch at the Kutub near Delhi
caption: The Iron Pillar at Qutb

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Flamingoes taking to flight on Lake Nakuru
Description: A large flock of flamingoes take to flight on the shoreline of Lake Nakuru.
caption: Flamingoes taking to flight on Lake Nakuru

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Ivory Room, Mombasa
Description:
A European man works at a desk in a warehouse stacked full of elephant tusks, confiscated and intended for sale at auction.

Original manuscript caption:The ivory room at Mombasa.  These are confiscated and "found" tusks, to be sold at auction. 1933.
caption: Ivory Room, Mombasa

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Children playing in Old Mombasa Harbour
Description:
Three children play at the stern of a dhow in the shallow waters of Old Mombasa harbour

Original manuscript caption: A dhow, Mombasa, 1933
caption: Children playing in Old Mombasa Harbour

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The defensive outer wall of Fort Jesus
Description:
The defensive outer wall of Fort Jesus. At the time of this photograph, and up until 1958 while Kenya was a British colony, the fort was used as a government prison. 

Original manuscript caption: Fort Jesus 1933.
caption: The defensive outer wall of Fort Jesus

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Three Kikuyu Home Guards
Description:
Three Kikuyu Home Guards stand to attention, wearing uniforms and carrying mock rifles made of wood. 

Original manuscript caption: Kikuyu Guard
caption: Three Kikuyu Home Guards

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Government de-oathing ceremony
Description: A Mau Mau detainee sitting in the centre of a circle of men in a fenced compound is ‘purified’ of the Mau Mau oath.
caption: Government de-oathing ceremony

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A field terraced by the Soil Conservation Service
Description:
A field is divided into narrow, contoured terraces as part of erosion control measures carried out by the Soil Conservation Service. The organisation was formed in 1938 in response to a series of disastrous droughts, which had accelerated erosion in the region causing major crop failures and loss of livestock. 
 
Original manuscript caption: Erosion control. Terracing carried out by the Conservation Service.
caption: A field terraced by the Soil Conservation Service

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Picking pyrethrum on a Kenyan farm
Description:
A Kikuyu woman wearing traditional dress and jewellery picks pyrethrum flowers (Chrysanthemum cinerariaefolium) on a Kenyan farm, probably Nellie Grant's farm at Njoro. 

Original manuscript caption: Picking pyrethrum on a Kenyan farm. Kipsigis woman?
caption: Picking pyrethrum on a Kenyan farm

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A Kikuyu couple in a Western-style home
Description:
A Kikuyu employee of the government's Agricultural Department sits at a table drinking tea with his wife in their new Western-style home. 

Original manuscript caption: The modern world is breaking in. An educated Kikuyu, employed by the government's agricultural department, & his wife in a new-style home, square instead of round, with windows & doors.
caption: A Kikuyu couple in a Western-style home

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Telling fortunes by beans
Description:
A group of Kikuyu men gather around to read their fortunes by scattering beans on the ground. 

Original manuscript caption: Telling fortunes by beans. 
S. Nyeri 1936
caption: Telling fortunes by beans

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Portrait of a Kikuyu woman
Description:
Portrait of a smiling Kikuyu woman gesturing at the camera. Her head is shaven, indicating her status as a married woman, and she wears a number of hooped earrings. 

Original manuscript caption: An old Kikuyu woman.
About 1934
caption: Portrait of a Kikuyu woman

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Plantain stall at Karatina market
Description:
Kikuyu traders display large bunches of plaintains on a stall at Karatina market. 

Original manuscript caption: Another part of Karatina market.
S. Nyeri, 1936.
caption: Plantain stall at Karatina market

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Storm clouds over Lumbwa
Description:
Storm clouds gather over a small valley settlement in the hills near Lumbwa, Rift Valley.This photograph, numbered "19" on the reverse, has been removed from the series "Miscellaneous views 1934", found at 1995/076/1/1/3.

Original manuscript caption: Kenya Folder No 2, 1933/34.
Storm gathering over hills at Lumbwa.
caption: Storm clouds over Lumbwa

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Duke and Duchess of Connaught at Cape Town
Description:
The Duke and Duchess of Connaught leave Cape Town's Houses of Parliament along a red carpet following the opening ceremony of the new Union Parliament. 4 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Friday, November 4
12 noon. Houses of Parliament, opening of Parliament. Full dress.
Afternoon. Visit to Pageant. Frock coat and tall hat.
8 P.M. Government House, Dinner Party. Plain clothes.
Later. Government House, Reception.
caption: Duke and Duchess of Connaught at Cape Town

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Outside the Houses of Parliament, Cape Town
Description:
Princess Patricia is escorted along a red carpet leaving Cape Town's Houses of Parliament following the opening ceremony of the new Union Parliament. 4 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Friday, November 4
12 noon. Houses of Parliament, opening of Parliament. Full dress.
Afternoon. Visit to Pageant. Frock coat and tall hat.
8 P.M. Government House, Dinner Party. Plain clothes.
Later. Government House, Reception.
caption: Outside the Houses of Parliament, Cape Town

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Reception for the Duke of Connaught
Description: Formally dressed guests socialise at a garden party held in honour of the Duke and Duchess of Connaught. Originally described by BECM as a garden party in Bloemfontein, however Bloemfontein is inland and this image more closely resembles Cape Town. It could therefore be the pageant described in the itinerary as following the Duke's opening of Parliament.
caption: Reception for the Duke of Connaught

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Lion cub at a royal garden party
Description: Formally dressed guests are entertained by the release of a captive lion cub during a garden party held in honour of the Duke and Duchess of Connaught.
caption: Lion cub at a royal garden party

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Christian Kikuyu girl
Description:
A head and shoulders portrait of an adolescent Kikuyu girl wearing a blouse and pinafore. The girl is said to be a Christian and to have refused to take the Mau Mau oath, even after Mau Mau fighters had killed her sister for refusing to cooperate. 

Original typescript caption: A Kikuyu girl: she is a Christian and has resisted all attempts to force her to take the Mau Mau oath. Her sister was strangled by Mau Mau for refusal to co-operate. Women are forced into service as food-carriers, and young girls often kidnapped to live in the forest as prostitutes for the gangs.
caption: Christian Kikuyu girl

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Adult literacy campaign, Gold Coast
Description:
A student teacher helps a man to read from a board propped up against the base of a tree during a literacy class; part of a mass literacy campaign launched by the British government in 1951 to improve literacy skills amongst African adults, both in their own languages and in English. 

Original manuscript caption: Mass literacy campaign in the N.T.s near the French frontier.
caption: Adult literacy campaign, Gold Coast

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Adult literacy campaign, Gold Coast
Description:
A student teacher helps men to read from a board during a literacy class; part of a mass literacy campaign launched by the British government in 1951 to improve literacy skills amongst African adults, both in their own languages and in English.

caption: Adult literacy campaign, Gold Coast

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Adult literacy campaign, Gold Coast
Description:
A student teacher helps men to read from a book during a literacy class; part of a mass literacy campaign launched by the British government in 1951 to improve literacy skills amongst African adults, both in their own languages and in English. 

Original manuscript caption: Mass literacy class. NTs [Northern Territories]
caption: Adult literacy campaign, Gold Coast

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu purification ceremony
Description:
A Kikuyu man takes part in a purification ceremony, drinking a concoction from the nose of a sacrificed goat.  It is administered by a "Mundu mugu" (magic man), and either spat or vomited out to cleanse the perpetrator of their sins. 

Original manuscript caption: Purification ceremony, S. Nyeri, 1936
Mundu mugu standing. 1936. Supplicant drinking a concoction made from various herbs & minerals, & the undigested contents of a goats stomach, from the nose of the dead goat
caption: Kikuyu purification ceremony

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Boats in the Old Harbour at Stone Town
Description:
Dhows and row boats are moored at the Old Harbour in Stone Town, Zanzibar. This harbour was once a centre of trade between East Africa and the Middle East until colonisation of the mainland in the 1880s transferred trade to Mombasa and Dar es Salaam. 

Original manuscript caption: Dhows anchored off Zanzibar harbour.
caption: Boats in the Old Harbour at Stone Town

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu good fortune ceremony
Description:
A group of Kikuyu men gather in a circle, performing a ceremony to bring good fortune to anyone embarking on a journey. 

Original manuscript caption: A ceremony constructed to bring good fortune to anyone embarking on a journey. The witchdoctor collects herbs etc from all the paths leading from the village, & spits on them (spittle brings good luck)
caption: Kikuyu good fortune ceremony

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Mount Kenya
Description:
The summit of Mount Kenya is partially obscured by cloud. This is likely to have been taken very early in 1937, on the safari EH and her mother took whilst staying at Chief Murigo's camp. Further photographs from this trip can be found at 1995/076/1/1/8.

Original manuscript caption: Kenya safari from Murigo's.  1936
caption: Mount Kenya

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Light aircraft used to spot game
Description:
Several men surround a light aircraft used to spot game on safari. This image is believed to have been removed from the Blixen album, 1995/076/7/3.

EH manuscript caption: Light aircraft used for spotting game on safari, landed in the bush. Tanganyika,1927
caption: Light aircraft used to spot game

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu woman wearing traditional jewellery
Description:
Portrait of a Kikuyu woman wearing traditional jewellery including copper armbands and elaborate ear decorations. 

Original manuscript caption: A Kikuyu woman, 1932/33, with the old style ear - decoration & copper rings round arms (& legs).
caption: Kikuyu woman wearing traditional jewellery

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Debating at a Kikuyu council
Description:
A Kikuyu 'njama' (elder) talks animatedly during a debate at a 'kiana' (council of elders). 

Original manuscript caption: Another Kikuyu elder, engaged in an argument in the Kiana, or council of elders. S.Nyeri 1936
caption: Debating at a Kikuyu council

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Pay day on a Kenyan farm
Description:
Kenyan farm hands gather around a European farmer's wife as she calculates their wages. 

Original manuscript caption: On a Kenya farm - the farmer's wife paying the labour
caption: Pay day on a Kenyan farm

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu children exercising
Description: Children perform coordinated exercises in a secure village established for the families of the Kikuyu Home Guard
caption: Kikuyu children exercising

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Group of Abyssinians at Gallabat
Description:
Printed caption reads: 'Abyssinians at Gallabat. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 186'. Armed guard at the Sudan-Ethiopia border
A number of armed Ethiopian men stand in front of a round, thatched hut at Gallabat, guarding the border crossing between Sudan and Ethiopia. A union jack flag is raised on a flagpole to the left of the photograph.
caption: Group of Abyssinians at Gallabat

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Six uniformed Sudanese soldiers armed with rifles
Description: Printed caption reads: 'Types of Sudanese Soldiers. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 81'. Five Sudanese men and a young boy pose for the camera, wearing a variety of Egyptian Army military uniforms. All are dressed in fez hats, their uniform varying according to their station.
caption: Six uniformed Sudanese soldiers armed with rifles

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Portrait of a young girl dressed in a grass skirt
Description: Printed caption reads: 'Young Girl, Omdurman. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 143'. Portrait of a young Sudanese girl, standing barefoot against the backdrop of a white sheet with one hand on her hip. She is a grass skirt and jewellery, including anklets, bracelets and necklaces.
caption: Portrait of a young girl dressed in a grass skirt

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Group of women and children
Description: Printed caption reads: 'Native Women, Omdurman. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 148'. A group of Sudanese women crouch and stand together beside a high mud wall. They wear traditional dress including decorated headscarves, patterned robes and ornate, beaded jewellery.
caption: Group of women and children

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Sudanese street traders selling silver, Khartoum
Description: Printed caption reads: 'The Silver Show Khartoum. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 51'. A line of Sudanese street traders, many of them adolescents or children, display a variety of silverware on their stalls.
caption: Sudanese street traders selling silver, Khartoum

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Boy mounted on a donkey
Description: Printed caption reads: 'A Donkey Boy, Khartoum. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 121'. Portrait of a Sudanese boy, sitting astride a harnessed donkey beside a tributary of the River Nile.
caption: Boy mounted on a donkey

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Post Office at Khartoum
Description: Printed caption reads: 'The Post Office, Khartoum. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 202'. Showing the post office building, a phaeton drawn up outside and palm trees.
caption: The Post Office at Khartoum

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Sheikhs at Kordofan
Description: Printed caption reads: 'Sheikes of Kordofan. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 114'. A group of Sheikhs pose for a photograph.

Title: Clothes market in Hong Kong
Description:
Clothes market in Hong Kong
Street traders display their wares at a busy clothes market. Behind them are several multi-storey resettlement blocks, which were built all over Kowloon by the British government to re-house 70,000 people after fire destroyed an overcrowded squatter settlement in 1953. 
Original Manuscript Caption: Old clothes market outside one of the huge resettlement buildings
caption: Clothes market in Hong Kong

Description:
Letter-writing service on a Hong Kong street
A Chinese scribe sits at his street stall, concentrating as he writes a letter for a female customer. 
Original Manuscript Caption: A Chinese roadside writer who claims to be able to write all kinds of Chinese and English letters, documents, applications, government and business forms etc.
caption: Letter-writing service on a Hong Kong street

Title: African leader [King?] surrounded by his retainers and family
Description:
Marking on reverse: 'Badagry 1927'
An unidentified chief, perhaps the Akran of Badagry, is seated wearing elaborate embroidered robes with a high-sided and tasselled cap. He holds a staff of office and is surrounded by children sitting on the ground, one of whom holds a fan edged with feathers.
caption: African leader [King?] surrounded by his retainers and family

Labourers work on the construction of railway tunnel 'No. 10', which would later house a stretch of track on the Port Antonio extension line.
Caption in the negative reads: Tunnel No.10, E. End. Jamaica Ry. Port Antonio Ext.
caption: Railway tunnel No. 10, Jamaica

Caption reads: 'Mr & Mrs Baxendale of Miller Bros: Staff Badagry 1924'.
Mr and Mrs Baxendale (centre) pose for the camera with African employees of Miller Brothers & Co. The six young African men behind them are dressed mostly in white, possibly house servants or office staff. Two African men in formal Western dress sit on either side of the Baxendales in cane armchairs.

Title: Fishing with a cast net
Description:
Fishing with a cast net
A Tahitian man wearing a printed 'pareu' (sarong) hurls a cast net into shallow waters off the coast. Opposite him, a woman wearing a flowered lei pilots a canoe equipped with an outrigger. Tahiti, French Polynesia, 1965.
This type of fishing with the cast net is found in many places throughout the world - from the West Indies to Ceylon and Japan
caption: Fishing with a cast net

Description:
Catching a Striped Marlin, Bay of Islands, New Zealand 
Fishermen haul a Striped Marlin onto a fishing boat during big game fishing at the Bay of Islands.   Another Marlin already lies at the stern of the fishing boat.
Caption reads BIG GAME FISHING AT THE BAY OF ISLANDS.  A STRIPED MARLIN
caption: Catching a Striped Marlin, Bay of Islands, New Zealand

Caption reads: Caparo Valley Ry. Extension. Junction of Extension with main line running off to left.
caption: Caparo Valley extension line, Trinidad

Title: View of the dockyard, Port Royal, Jamaica

Title: Boats on the Ayeyarwady River
Description:
Boats on the Ayeyarwady River
Several covered fishing boats are moored along a sandy bank of the Ayeyarwady River. Htagaing, Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
Caption reads: 'Htigaing  No.441'
caption: Boats on the Ayeyarwady River

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Royal Artillery in Sagaing
Description:
The Royal Artillery in Sagaing
British Army soldiers from a Royal Artillery regiment pose in front of a wooden building with a pagoda-style roof. The company was involved in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (today known as the Sagaing Division). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), circa 1891.
caption: The Royal Artillery in Sagaing

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Stone 'zeidis' at Wuntho
Description:
Stone 'zeidis' at Wuntho
Several carved stone 'zeidis' or pagodas are guarded by stone 'chinthes' (mythical Burmese lions) at Wuntho. This scene was captured shortly after British forces took control of Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Pagodas at Wuntho. 425'
caption: Stone 'zeidis' at Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Guard house on the Morgandine Pass
Description:
Guard house on the Morgandine Pass
Turbaned Indian soldiers stand outside a guard house, situated in a village on the Morgadine Pass. These men were part of forces supporting the British Army in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (today known as the Sagaing Division). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Village & Guard-house on the Morgandine Pass. No.446'
caption: Guard house on the Morgandine Pass

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A military expedition in Burma
Description:
A military expedition in Burma (Myanmar)
A series of small watercolour sketches recounts a British Army expedition to Burma (Myanmar) at the time of the country's annexation by the British. As well as battle scenes, there are several portraits of prisoners and of various Burmese villagers encountered during the journey. Burma (Myanmar), January-April, 1891.
Caption reads: 'The Mourish Expedition - January 1891 to April 1891 No. 461'
caption: A military expedition in Burma

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: British Army officers in Wuntho
Description:
British Army officers in Wuntho
British Army officers pose informally at the the base of a carved stone 'zeidi' or pagoda at Wuntho. The group are pictured shortly after British forces captured Wuntho following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Officers of the Southern Column. No.443'
NB 2003/001/001/18 is a duplicate copy of this photograph
caption: British Army officers in Wuntho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A working-class Chinese funeral
Description:
A group of mourners, including one paid mourner dressed in white, gather for the burial of a working-class person. A simple coffin, constructed from four lengths of timber bound together, lies on the ground beside a freshly dug grave. 

Original manuscript caption: Chinese funeral (poor people). Paid mourner in white with hair down.
caption: A working-class Chinese funeral

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Staircase for a coffin
Description:
A coffin sits at the top of a makeshift staircase attached to the exterior of a three-storey building. Staircases such as these were designed to convey the body of the deceased to the street without using the internal stairwell, an act that was considered to invoke bad fortune. Probably Hong Kong.

Original manuscript caption: Preparing for funeral. At death the windows are opened to let evil spirit out, - otherwise they will haunt house - the mortal remains must never return to house, or go down staircase, but are carried down impromptu outside staircase. Note coffin at top.
caption: Staircase for a coffin

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A wealthy Chinese funeral procession
Description:
Mourners at a wealthy Chinese funeral procession follow a coffin along a city street. Traditionally, the closest family members to the deceased wore black, whilst more distant relations wore lighter colours or white. Children's heads would often be covered with sackcloth hoods as a sign of respect. 

Original manuscript caption: Chinese Funeral - (well- to- do)
caption: A wealthy Chinese funeral procession

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Duke of Connaught visits Hong Kong
Description:
A team of Chinese bearers, wearing a uniform of scarlet coats and velvet hats, carry the Duke of Connaught through the streets of Hong Kong in a sedan chair. The Duke made his visit shortly before a devastating typhoon struck the city on 18 September. 

Original manuscript caption: Prince Arthur of Connaught in chair & coolie bearers. It is infra dig for high officials to travel in any other way. They never use rickshaws. Coolies uniform- scarlet coats. White crown on arm, scarlet velvet hats. Note! Official swing of arm. Note! Our typical British policeman
caption: The Duke of Connaught visits Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Statue of a Joss
Description:
Statue of a Chinese deity (a 'Joss'), located in a Joss house in Hong Kong. The figure is depicted as a warrier, wearing a crown and armour, and holding a sword. 

Original manuscript caption: Joss.
caption: Statue of a Joss

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Geisha posing on a rickshaw
Description:
Portrait of two geisha from a tea house. They sit side-by-side on a staionary rickshaw, dressed in traditional kimonos and 'geta' (Japanese wooden sandals), with their hair worn up in 'shimada' style. 

Original manuscript caption: Moji - Tea House Girls
caption: Geisha posing on a rickshaw

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Freshening up at railway station in Manchuria
Description:
A group of Japanese travellers refresh themselves at a railway station in southern Manchuria, washing their feet in a series of wooden sinks equipped with running water. 

Original manuscript caption: Japanese refreshing themselves - Railway Station, S. Manchuria
caption: Freshening up at railway station in Manchuria

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Chinese girls in a public garden in Hong Kong
Description:
Three Chinese girls, accompanied by an 'amah' (nursemaid), sit on a wooden bench in a public garden. They are dressed in traditional 'shenyi' and their hair is neatly tied up. 

Original manuscript caption: Chinese girls and Amah in garden Hong Kong.
caption: Chinese girls in a public garden in Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Cave dwellings on the banks of the Yellow River
Description:
A number of cave dwellings, built into a cliff face on the banks of the Yellow River. 

Original manuscript caption: Cave dwellings on banks of Yellow River Central China
caption: Cave dwellings on the banks of the Yellow River

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A medicine stall in Hong Kong
Description:
A man wearing a traditional Manchu hairstyle squats beside a row of glass bottles, chatting to a medicine man at a street stall in Hong Kong. 

Original manuscript caption: Chinese Medicine Man
caption: A medicine stall in Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A Chinese policeman
Description:
A Chinese policeman, dressed in police uniform and a Western-style hat, smiles at the camera from a doorway. Another man sits at a workbench behind him. 

Original manuscript caption: Yangtse Wuku- Delapidated though smiling policeman
caption: A Chinese policeman

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Guardhouse at Chien Men Gate, Peking
Description:
The guardhouse at Chien Men Gate, a fortified complex in the city of Peking. An example of typical Hakka architecture, the guardhouse features one entrance with no windows at ground level. 

Original manuscript caption: Outer Tower on wall outside Chien Men Gate of Tatar City.
caption: Guardhouse at Chien Men Gate, Peking

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: European man with Chinese farming tool
Description:
A European man, dressed in a suit and solatopi hat, holds a large, three-pronged fork as he chats to a Chinese farm labourer, Northern China

Original manuscript caption: Great Plain of China - natural 3- pronged forks, Goughin & Celestial

The date of this photo was given as 1920 during an earlier cataloguing effort; however it appears within the album with a group of pictures from 1909/1910.
caption: European man with Chinese farming tool

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Market square in Wan Chai
Description:
A view of a market square at the foot of Morrison Hill in Wan Chai, Hong Kong, where only a couple of street traders have set their stalls up by a tall, stone monument, which stands in the centre.

Original manuscript caption: Hong Kong - Monument and market at foot of Morrison Hill - Close to Naval Hospital.
caption: Market square in Wan Chai

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Fountain in Hong Kong's Botanical Gardens
Description:
A water fountain surrounded by foliage forms the centrepiece of an ornamental pond in Hong Kong's Botanical Gardens.

Original manuscript caption: Hong Kong Fountain in Botanical Gardens
caption: Fountain in Hong Kong's Botanical Gardens

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Eastern part of Hong Kong Harbour
Description:
View over the eastern front of Hong Kong harbour, an area known today as 'Admiralty'. 

Original manuscript caption: "No. 8 Hong Kong    1903   View of Hong Kong of the Eastern part of the harbour, looking down about 200 - 300 feet. To eastern left of picture is Hong Kong Club (Synau Building) close to water edge- then two more large offices. Then to right of there New Admiral dock (in course of construction) and to right of this New Admiral works . There is a local agitation to get all these shifted from here- over to the Kowloon side-chiefly I think by people interested in prospects close by.
Note HMS Tamar (roofed in with 3 masts) off end of new dock
Note St John's Cathedral- with Synau Town, just inland to new dock (really 1/4 mile away and much higher up).
Note dome just inland to HK Club of Hong Kong Shanghai Bank- and inland to this (near bottom of picture)
Note roof of Governors residence & gardens
To right hand bottom corner note white square areas- these are  small service reservoirs for the town."
caption: Eastern part of Hong Kong Harbour

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Swimming fun, Abazai
Description: Three European men pose for a comical photograph after a swim, wearing only swimming trunks with towels wrapped around their shoulders. One man stands on a mooring post between his companions, holding their solatopi hats several inches above their heads. The "bathing picnic" is described in Winthrop's diary.
caption: Swimming fun, Abazai

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Canal bank picnic, Abazai
Description:
Group of friends having a picnic next to the canal at Abazai. Many are wearing pith helmets and there appears to be a servant waiting on them.

Original manuscript caption: ABAZAI
11/4/20
caption: Canal bank picnic, Abazai

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Bathing picnic, Abazai
Description:
View of Winthrop and friends standing next to a makeshift diving board on the canal at Abazai. The group are named in the caption.

Original manuscript caption: D.F. Guise H.E.W. Poynder E.F. C.O.H.
caption: Bathing picnic, Abazai

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Khajjiar
Description:
View of a grassy open space at Khajjiar, where Winthrop and Maclagan stopped for lunch en route back from Chamba. Four Indian men are in the middle ground.

Original manuscript caption: KAJIAR 25/4/20
caption: Khajjiar

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Royal visit at the Residency, Chamba

The[y] are volunteers and unpaid and have killed or captured many hundreds of armed gangsters.

Title: Arch at the ruins of Gedi

Original manuscript caption: Part of the ruins of Gedi, now crumbling in the forest in the coast near Malindi. No one knows who built Gedi & when, or why it fell into decay. It was a large city, & one theory holds that it was built by the Persians about AD 1,000. More probably, Arab, built in C17.
Hux 4/27

caption: Pro-government Kikuyu and a Catholic priest

Description: Printed caption reads: 'Osman Digna, A Noted Leader in the Khalifa's Army. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 243'. Portrait of Osman Digna, sitting cross-legged on a mat, wearing a robe and turban. Digna was a general in the Mahdist army of Sudan from 1883 until his arrest by the British in 1900.
caption: Osman Digna, a leader in the Khalifa's Army

Title: A Kikuyu metalsmith at work

The bellows are goatskins (legs). Knifes, pangas, swords & fire chains are made with these primitive tools. South Nyeri 1936

Near Karatina, South Nyeri, 1936.

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A Basuto chief visits the Duke of Connaught
Description:
One of several Basuto chiefs arrives at a reception to meet the Duke and Duchess of Connaught following their official opening of the new Union Parliament at Cape Town. He is led by a European dignitary and followed by a group of African drummers. Bloemfontein, 9 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Wednesday, November 9
9.40 A.M. Bloemfontein, Arrive. Uniform- blue frock coat and white helmet throuhgout.
10 A.M. Town Hall, Presentation of Address.
11 A.M. Review. Chargers will be provided. Presentation of Colours (if ready).
1 P.M. Government House, Lunch (Administrator). 
Afternoon. Reception of Basuto Chiefs. Frock coat and tall hat. Garden Party given by Municipality. Guests will be informed that frock coats and tall hats need not be worn.
6 P.M. Leave for Victoria Falls.
caption: A Basuto chief visits the Duke of Connaught

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Duke of Connaught watches an African dance
Description:
An African woman performs a dance for the Duke and Duchess of Connaught at an outdoor reception by Bechuanaland chiefs. 24 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Thursday, November 24
9.10 A.M. to 11.10 A.M. Gaberones. Reception of Khama and other Bechuanaland  Chiefs. Plain clothes.
caption: Duke of Connaught watches an African dance

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kamasia mountain range, Rift Valley
Description:
An acacia tree frames a range of distant mountains at a camp site in open country, Rift Valley. This photograph, numbered "8" on the reverse, appears to have been removed from the series "Safari to Lake Baringo 1934", found at 1995/076/1/1/6.

Original manuscript caption: A view of the Kamasia range, Baringo district.
caption: Kamasia mountain range, Rift Valley

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Victoria Falls
Description:
View of Victoria Falls, situated on the Zambezi River on the border between modern-day Zambia and Zimbabwe. 12 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Saturday, November 12
8.20 A.M. Victoria Falls. Arrive at bridge over Zambesi. See Victoria Falls, North Bank. Plain clothes or khaki uniform will be worn throughout in Rhodesia.
caption: Victoria Falls

Title: The English Pharmacy at Khartoum
Description: Printed caption reads: 'The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 11'. Exterior view of the English Pharmacy in Khartoum, an arcaded, brick building with a flat roof. The grand, colonial-style, three-storey building was named in honour of General Charles Gordon (1833-1885).

caption: Lines of military figures outside the Gordon College, Khartoum

Title: Group of Shilluks, Upper Nile

caption: Group of Shilluks, Upper Nile

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Governor's boat, called the Elfin on the Blue Nile
Description: Printed caption reads: 'The Governor's Boat (the "Elfin") in the Blue Nile. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 17'. A paddle steamer named 'The Elfin' travels along the River Nile, flying a British Empire flag at its stern and a Ottoman Empire flag at its bow.
caption: Governor's boat, called the Elfin on the Blue Nile

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Government House, Wad Madani
Description: Printed caption reads: 'Government House, Wad Medani. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 181'. View of Government House at Wad Madani, a large, two-storey building with rounded arch windows, pinnicles along its parapet, and two square towers.
caption: Government House, Wad Madani

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Sudanese cavalry in a 'tent-pegging' competition
Description: Printed caption reads: 'Tent Pegging by Sudanese Cavalry. Published by G N Morhig, The English Pharmacy, Khartoum. Copyright 233'. A crowd of onlookers watch as four Sudanese cavalrymen of the Anglo-Egyptian army engage in a 'tent-pegging' competition. 'Tent-pegging' is a traditional cavalry sport that requires the rider to pick up small ground targets using a sword or lance whilst riding at a gallop.
caption: Sudanese cavalry in a 'tent-pegging' competition

A man stands at the stern of one of several small sailboats, which are berthed in a shallow bay. This photograph was moved here from its original series 1995/076/1/1/3.

Original manuscript caption: Dhows at rest
caption: Dhows at rest

caption: Dhow captain, Kalifi ferry

Title: Repairing a dhow at Lamu
Description:
Men repair a dhow, which is on the beach at Lamu.

Title: Home Guards at a Kikuyu security village
Description:
Armed Kikuyu Home Guards at a fortified security village. To the left, Kikuyu men can be seen digging a moat to provide further protection against Mau Mau attack. 

Original manuscript caption: Bridge over a moat round a security village.
caption: Home Guards at a Kikuyu security village

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Searching the bush for Mau Mau terrorists
Description: Six men, their backs to the camera, look out towards the forest in search of Mau Mau fighters. The two uniformed men on the left are from the Kenya Police, the European man in the middle is the district officer and the three men on the right are Kikuyu Home Guards.
caption: Searching the bush for Mau Mau terrorists

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Children in Kikuyu security village
Description:
Children perform coordinated exercises in a secure village established for the families of the Kikuyu Home Guard. 

Original manuscript caption: Schoolchildren in KG security village
caption: Children in Kikuyu security village

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Rehabilitation scheme for Mau Mau detainees
Description:
Two Europeans inspect an irrigation channel, constructed by Mau Mau detainees as part of a rehabilitation scheme. 

Original manuscript caption: Perherra rehabilitation scheme. Fencing plain below Embu.
caption: Rehabilitation scheme for Mau Mau detainees

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Home Guard living quarters
Description: Numbered prefabricated huts form temporary accommodation for Kikuyu Home Guards.
caption: Home Guard living quarters

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Prince Edward of Wales on safari
Description:
Prince Edward of Wales (right), later King Edward VIII, sits at a table beneath a tree, drinking tea with two companions whilst on safari in Tanganyika. This image is believed to have been removed from the Blixen album, 1995/076/7/3.

EH manuscript caption: Edward Prince of Wales (right) on safari in Tanganyika (Tanzania) in 1927. Denys Finch Hatton centre, Assistant "white hunter" left.
caption: Prince Edward of Wales on safari

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Measuring up the coffee
Description:
A European farmer oversees his African workers as they measure out a morning's harvest of coffee beans at a plantation. 
 
Original manuscript caption: Farmer measuring up the coffee from a morning's picking.
caption: Measuring up the coffee

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A tea estate at Kericho
Description:
Two European farmers stand waist-deep in tea bushes on the Brooke Bond tea estate in Kericho. This area of south west Kenya has a high altitude and regular rainfall, making it particularly suitable for tea cultivation. 

Original manuscript caption: Tea at Kericho. Brooke Bond estate (or Jamji).
caption: A tea estate at Kericho

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Disc ploughing at Njoro
Description:
Two European men crouch down to examine a furrow of earth made by disc ploughing. A team of yoked cattle stand nearby, harnessed to a plough in the middle of a muddy field. Although this image has been annotated by EH as being from 1947, the contact prints actually suggest it was taken in the 1930s.

Original manuscript caption: Examining the furrow - ploughing virgin land (disc ploughing) at Njoro. 1947.
caption: Disc ploughing at Njoro

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Feeding the cows, Kenya
Description:
An African farm hand feeds a herd of Friesian cows on a Kenyan farm. 

Original manuscript caption: Milking was often done in pails moved about in the open pastures. In areas of low rainfall, a ranch might cover 30,000 to 40,000 acres.
caption: Feeding the cows, Kenya

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Milking Friesians on a farm near Molo
Description:
Friesian cows stand in the stalls of a cowshed, being milked by African farm hands on a farm near Molo. 

Original manuscript caption: Milking Friesians on a farm near Molo. One man one cow.
caption: Milking Friesians on a farm near Molo

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu married woman
Description:
Portrait of a Kikuyu woman wearing traditional jewellery.

Original manuscript caption: Kikuyu married woman, S. Nyeri, 1936. One of Chief Murigo's 19 wives. p. 277
caption: Kikuyu married woman

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A meeting of Kikuyu elders
Description:
A group of Kikuyu men gather in a circle to drink beer from a hollow bullock's horn, a privilege granted only to tribal elders. 

Original manuscript caption: Consuming the beer, in those days (1936 & earlier) allowed only to elders. The drinking vessels are a hollow bullock's horn. South Nyeri
caption: A meeting of Kikuyu elders

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A Kikuyu metalsmith
Description:
A Kikuyu metalsmith hammers a knife blade into shape using an anvil in his workshop. 

Original manuscript caption: The Smith beats out a knife blade on his anvil. South Nyeri 1936
caption: A Kikuyu metalsmith

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Making beer
Description:
Three Kikuyu men making beer from sugar cane using the traditional method.

Original manuscript caption: Presing juice from sugar cane to make beer. S. Nyeri 1936. The juice is collected on an ox hide & poured into gourds to ferment. The resultant brew is stronger than beer made from millet.
caption: Making beer

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu ritual circumcision dance
Description:
Kikuyu women perform a ceremonial dance during an annual circumcision ritual, marking the initiation of adolescent girls into adulthood. 

Original manuscript caption: Dance before the circumcision of girls at puberty, by an old woman with a rusty knife (Cliterodectomy). 
South Nyeri, 1936.
caption: Kikuyu ritual circumcision dance

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A Kikuyu healer
Description:
Portrait of a smiling Kikuyu man, labelled in an original caption as a witch doctor. He wears a robe tied at the shoulder with earrings and a beaded necklace. 

Original manuscript caption: Kikuyu witchdoctor,
S. Nyeri 1936
caption: A Kikuyu healer

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Gourd stall at Karatina market
Description:
Shoppers haggle with Kikuyu traders over slender, hollow gourds at Karatina market. 

Original manuscript caption: Slender hollow gourds, much in demand for keeping beans etc & witchdoctors' potions, on sale at Karatina market
S. Nyeri 1936
caption: Gourd stall at Karatina market

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: A Kikuyu family pottery
Description:
Three Kikuyu women look after several small children as they make clay pots outdoors at a "family pottery". 

Original manuscript caption: A Kikuyu family pottery.
S. Nyeri, 1936.
caption: A Kikuyu family pottery

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu woman pouring milk
Description:
A Kikuyu woman, wearing a Western-style dress and headscarf, pours milk from a bucket into a milk churn on an outdoor workbench.

Original manuscript caption: A "modern" Kikuyu wife with the milk supply. 
S. Nyeri 1936
caption: Kikuyu woman pouring milk

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Exporting mangrove poles
Description:
Men load mangrove poles onto a dhow at Lamu, ready for export to the Persian Gulf. 

Original manuscript caption: Lamu- loading mangrove poles, the main export of the island, onto a dhow which will take them to the Persian Gulf when the right monsoon blows- a trade which has scarcely changed for at least 1,000 years.
Hux 1/15
caption: Exporting mangrove poles

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu settlement below the Aberdare Mountains
Description:
Thatched huts belonging to a Kikuyu settlement sit in a valley below the Aberdare Mountains. 

Original manuscript caption: Kikuyu huts & view in Kenya.  Over Rift Valley, looking towards Aberdare mountains.
caption: Kikuyu settlement below the Aberdare Mountains

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Duke of Connaught at Cape Town
Description:
The Duke and Duchess of Connaught ride past Cape Town city hall in a horse-drawn carriage during their royal visit to open the new Union Parliament. The hall is festooned with garlands. 31 October 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Monday, October 31
11 A.M. Cape Town, Land. Full Dress
11.30 A.M. City Hall, Presentation of Address
8 P.M. Government House, Private Dinner.
caption: The Duke of Connaught at Cape Town

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Lama priest at the doorway to a temple
Description:
A 'lama' (Buddhist monk) stands at the entrance to a temple wearing a simple robe, buckled at the waist, Peking

Original manuscript caption: Llama Priest
caption: Lama priest at the doorway to a temple

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Kyaing-Kwintaung stockade following its capture
Description:
After the capture of Kyaing-Kwintaung
General Wolseley and soldiers of the Second Devonshire Regiment stand beneath the Kyaing-Kwintaung stockade following its capture. The stronghold was seized from the Saopha of Wuntho and his rebel supporters, who opposed British attempts to annex areas of Burma (Myanmar). Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'The Hill Stockade of Kyaing-Kwintaung (after capture). General Wolesley & Coy. Of 2nd Devon Regt. In the foreground. No. 407.'
caption: The Kyaing-Kwintaung stockade following its capture

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Soldiers visit a Burmese village
Description:
Soldiers visit a Burmese village
British and Indian soldiers visit a Burmese village. Possibly a mix of British Army and Military Police officers, the men were involved in a campaign to suppress Burmese rebels in Wuntho State (Sagaing Division). A local man works a wooden lathe, whilst others sit inside carts pulled by bullocks. Youngma, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Village of Youngma. No.448'
caption: Soldiers visit a Burmese village

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View across Victoria Harbour
Description:
A view of Victoria Harbour, taken from Hong Kong Island and overlooking the Kowloon peninsula. A Royal Navy dockyard can be seen off Hong Kong Island, where several ships of the naval fleet are moored. 

Original manuscript caption: Part of Hong Kong Harbour. 
Man- of- War anchorage with H.M.S. "Tamar" Depot Ship (white with roof) New naval dock in foreground. Kowloon in distance.
caption: View across Victoria Harbour

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Wuntho after its capture
Description:
Wuntho after its capture
A pathway flanked by low walls leads past a number of thatched dwellings towards the 'Pon-gyi kyaung' (Buddhist monastery) at Wuntho. This scene was captured shortly after British forces took control of the town following a conflict with Burmese rebels. Wuntho, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Remains of the Wuntho Palace. No.432'
caption: Wuntho after its capture

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Wolseley and Smyth follow a scout
Description:
Wolseley and Smyth follow a scout
A local Burmese scout leads General Wolseley, Major Smyth and other military officers into the countryside on horseback. Both officers led British Army troops against Burmese rebels during a conflict at Wuntho. Sagaing, Burma (Myanmar), 1891.
Caption reads: 'Genl. Wolseley, Major Smyth scout. No.402'
caption: Wolseley and Smyth follow a scout

caption: Home Guards at their living quarters

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Nellie Grant meets Kikuyu women
Description:
Nellie Grant, the wife of settler farmer Jos Grant and mother of EH, meets a group of Kikuyu women described as "squatter's wives" on her Njoro farm. "Squatters" were a category of Kikuyu farm labourers.

Original manuscript captions: Nellie Grant at Njoro with wives of her Kikuyu "squatters" circa 1947/8

(In pencil): Nellie with "squatters" wives at Njoro 1930's.
caption: Nellie Grant meets Kikuyu women

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Nile crocodile at Murchison Falls
Description:
A Nile crocodile (Crocodylus niloticus) bares its teeth at Murchison Falls, Northern Uganda

Original manuscript caption: Beside pool below Murchison Falls, Uganda.
caption: Nile crocodile at Murchison Falls

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Pyrethrum drying in the sun
Description:
Stretchers covered with pyrethrum flowers (Chrysanthemum cinerariaefolium) are left outdoors to dry in the sun. 

Original manuscript caption: Pyrethrum drying in trays in the sun.
caption: Pyrethrum drying in the sun

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu pyrethrum pickers
Description:
A Kikuyu woman and two girls, wearing traditional dress and jewellery, pick pyrethrum flowers (Chrysanthemum cinerariaefolium) on the Grants farm at Njoro.

Original manuscript caption: Kikuyu Pyrethrum pickers. Njoro.  1936/7.
The family came along too.
caption: Kikuyu pyrethrum pickers

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Picking coffee, Kenya
Description:
An African farm worker climbs the uppermost branches of a coffee tree as he picks coffee berries at a plantation. 

Original manuscript caption: Picking coffee.
caption: Picking coffee, Kenya

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Ploughing in the Uasin Gishu plateau
Description:
An African farm hand uses a tractor to plough a field in the Uasin Gishu plateau, Rift Valley. Although this image has been annotated by EH as being from 1947, the contact prints actually suggest it was taken in the 1930s.


Original manuscript caption: A tractor driver harrowing a field on the Uasin Gishu plateau, circa 1950s.
caption: Ploughing in the Uasin Gishu plateau

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu woman eating maize porridge
Description:
A Kikuyu woman sits on the ground eating a meal of maize porridge from a hollowed-out gourd. Her head is shaven, indicating her status as a married woman, and she wears masses of hooped earrings. 

Original manuscript caption: A young married woman enjoying a meal of maize porridge, the staple diet. When a girl marries, she shaves her head all over.
S. Nyeri 1936.
caption: Kikuyu woman eating maize porridge

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu elder discussing a dispute
Description:
A Kikuyu elder makes a point during a dispute at a council of elders.

Original manuscript caption: A Kikuyu elder discussing a dispute during a council of elders. Kakamega district 1936/7
caption: Kikuyu elder discussing a dispute

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Barge towed by steamer, River Juba
Description:
Group of African men on a barge with towing rope, River Juba. 

Original manuscript caption: A pretty bend of the Juba.  Barge towed behind steamer.
caption: Barge towed by steamer, River Juba

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Tombstone of Walter Ernest Stuart
Description:
Tombstone in Nairobi South Cemetery of Walter Ernest Stuart, who was killed by a lion in 1904

Original manuscript caption: The result of bad shooting
caption: Tombstone of Walter Ernest Stuart

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of H.M.S. Forte
Description:
View of H.M.S. Forte across the water with two European men standing in the foreground.

Original manuscript caption: Snapping H.M.S. Forte from the tender
caption: View of H.M.S. Forte

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Transport along the River Juba
Description:
View of figures on a barge being towed by a boat.

Original manuscript caption: The way my police travel on the Juba
caption: Transport along the River Juba

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Police lines
Description:
View of a parade ground with one storey building behind.

Original manuscript caption: Snap of Police lines
caption: Police lines

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Egrets in flight
Description:
Very distant view of birds seen across open land

Original manuscript caption: Egrets in flight
caption: Egrets in flight

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Camels, Somalia
Description:
View of houses with camels in the foreground.

Original manuscript caption: Juberland. Horses.
caption: Camels, Somalia

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Car stuck in flooded plains
Description:
Several men attend to a car, which is stuck in the mud on a flooded country track. This photograph is believed to have been taken on one of the safaris which EH took with the Lindstrom family, most likely the Serengeti safari in 1936 during which they were plagued with bad weather and floods. 

Original manuscript caption: Motoring in the rains in Northern Tanganyika. Fish on left 1933/34
caption: Car stuck in flooded plains

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu woman crafting pottery
Description:
A Kikuyu woman outdoors at a family pottery makes a clay pot, a traditional female skill.

Original manuscript caption: Making clay pots is one of the skills of the women. This is a family pottery.
S. Nyeri. 1936.
caption: Kikuyu woman crafting pottery

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Kikuyu woman grinding millet
Description:
A Kikuyu woman kneels on the ground as she grinds millet on a flat board. 

Original manuscript caption: Kikuyu woman grinding millet.
1930s
caption: Kikuyu woman grinding millet

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Opening of the new Union Parliament, Cape Town
Description:
The Duke and Duchess of Connaught are saluted and directed along a red carpet as they arrive for the opening ceremony of the new Union Parliament at Cape Town's Houses of Parliament. 4 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Friday, November 4
12 noon. Houses of Parliament, opening of Parliament. Full dress.
Afternoon. Visit to Pageant. Frock coat and tall hat.
8 P.M. Government House, Dinner Party. Plain clothes.
Later. Government House, Reception.
caption: Opening of the new Union Parliament, Cape Town

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Princess Patricia at Victoria Falls
Description:
A lady, probably Princess Patricia, smiles as her female companion leans over the edge of a shallow river on a day trip to Victoria Falls. 12 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Saturday, November 12
8.20 A.M. Victoria Falls. Arrive at bridge over Zambesi. See Victoria Falls, North Bank. Plain clothes or khaki uniform will be worn throughout in Rhodesia.
caption: Princess Patricia at Victoria Falls

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Dhows in the Old Harbour at Stone Town, Zanzibar
Description:
Three men sit beside the Old Harbour at Stone Town, Zanzibar, with several dhows moored nearby. This harbour was once a centre of trade between East Africa and the Middle East until colonisation of the mainland in the 1880s transferred trade to Mombasa and Dar es Salaam. 

Original manuscript caption:
ZANZIBAR. 1947
Dhows in the Old Harbour
caption: Dhows in the Old Harbour at Stone Town, Zanzibar

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: View of Victoria Falls
Description:
The Victoria Falls and surrounding cliffs as seen from the northern bank. 12 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Saturday, November 12
8.20 A.M. Victoria Falls. Arrive at bridge over Zambesi. See Victoria Falls, North Bank. Plain clothes or khaki uniform will be worn throughout in Rhodesia.
caption: View of Victoria Falls

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Buggy harnessed with mule and zebra
Description:
A man drives a buggy pulled by a zebra and a mule. 

Original manuscript caption: Unusual transport- zebra and mule harnessed to a buggy. Period 1925-30
Trained by Raltray
caption: Buggy harnessed with mule and zebra

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Aerial view of Batian Peak, Mount Kenya
Description:
An aerial view of Batian Peak, the highest peak of Mount Kenya at 5,199 metres, with snow below the summit. 

Original manuscript caption: An aerial view of the peak of Kenya.
caption: Aerial view of Batian Peak, Mount Kenya

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Royal tour, possibly Kandahar Island
Description: The Duke and Duchess of Connaught and their royal entourage receive a guided tour, probably on Kandahar Island.
caption: Royal tour, possibly Kandahar Island

Title: Portrait of two Arab men

Original manuscript caption: 1947
caption: Portrait of two Arab men

Original manuscript caption: KENYA.
Scene in the main square in Lamu, beside a refreshment booth.
caption: Snack food in Lamu

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Duke of Connaught and family
Description: The Duke of Connaught poses for a portrait with his wife, Duchess Luise Margarete, and his daughter, Princess Patricia, on the deck of S.S. Balmoral Castle. Probably South Atlantic Ocean, October 1910.
caption: The Duke of Connaught and family

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Ingredients for a Mau Mau oathing ceremony
Description:
A staged photograph of the ingredients and substances believed to be used by Mau Mau fighters when administering an oath of loyalty to new recruits. 

Original manuscript caption: Mau Mau paraphernalia
caption: Ingredients for a Mau Mau oathing ceremony

Title: Market stall in Accra

Original manuscript caption: In Accra market
caption: Market stall in Accra

Title: Fishing nets at a Ghanaian market

Original manuscript caption: Market scene near the Volta river.
caption: Fishing nets at a Ghanaian market

Description: The Duke and Duchess of Connaught visit the grave of Cecil Rhodes, located in the Matopos Hills.
caption: Visiting the grave of Cecil Rhodes

Title: Street trader in Ceylon
Description: A street trader sells a variety of dried foods at a busy outdoor market.
caption: Street trader in Ceylon

S. Nyeri, 1936.
caption: Kikuyu students at a mission school

EH manuscript caption: The old Uganda railway, Mombasa-Kisumu (completed 1900)
caption: Uganda Railways steam train

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives

 S. Nyeri 1936.
caption: A Kikuyu family outside their home

Luo Homesteads on the Kano plains near Lake Victoria.
caption: A Luo settlement on the Kano plains

caption: The Kano plains at South Kavirondo

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Canoes near Kandahar Island
Description:
A group of African men wearing traditional dress and headgear paddle canoes past Kandahar Island, Northern Rhodesia (Zambia), 13 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Sunday, November 13
Morning. Government House, Divine Service.
1 P.M Lunch. Guest: The Curate. Possibly also the Bishop of Northern Rhodesia.
4 P.M. To River and in Launch to Kandahar Island, where Tea will be taken.
8 P.M. Government House, Private Dinner, No guests.
caption: Canoes near Kandahar Island

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Saturday, November 12
8.20 A.M. Victoria Falls. Arrive at bridge over Zambesi. See Victoria Falls, North Bank. Plain clothes or khaki uniform will be worn throughout in Rhodesia.
caption: Admiring the Victoria Falls

Thursday, November 24
9.10 A.M. to 11.10 A.M. Gaberones. Reception of Khama and other Bechuanaland  Chiefs. Plain clothes.
caption: Bechuanaland chiefs await the Duke of Connaught

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Working against time and tide
Description:
A fisherman works against time and tide as he scrapes the barnacles from the underside of his dry-docked fishing junk ready for another fishing trip in the South China Sea.
Original Manuscript Caption: This fisherman is working against time and tide as he raises his fishing junk at low tide on a mud flat in order to scrape the barnacles from the bottom in preparation for another trip to fish in the South China Sea
caption: Working against time and tide

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: The Peak Tramway, Hong Kong
Description:
The Peak Tramway, Hong Kong
A tram runs along the Peak Tramway to the top of Victoria Peak, a tourist hotspot that commands views over Hong Kong Island's Central District, Victoria Harbour and the Kowloon peninsula. 
Original Manuscript Caption: The Central District of Victoria looking across the harbour to the Kowloon peninsula. The cable tram to the peak is a favourite excursion for tourists
caption: The Peak Tramway, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Rickshaw driver in Hong Kong
Description:
Rickshaw driver in Hong Kong
A rickshaw driver pulls his empty carriage along a commerical street in Hong Kong. Signs and advertisements written in Chinese script stretch away into the distance.  
Original Manuscript Caption: A main street in Hong Kong
caption: Rickshaw driver in Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Fishing in shallow waters
Description:
Fishing in shallow waters
A fisherman trawls his net in the shallow waters of a Hong Kong bay. 
Original Manuscript Caption: A fisherman working on shallow waters hold up his net
caption: Fishing in shallow waters

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Resettlement blocks in Kowloon
Description:
Resettlement blocks in Kowloon
Children play in a fenced park surrounded by multi-storey resettlement blocks. Blocks like these were built all over Kowloon by the British government to re-house 70,000 people after fire destroyed an overcrowded squatter settlement in 1953. 
Original Manuscript Caption: One of the many resettlement blocks in Kowloon. But in spite of these buildings, there are rarely less than seven people to each room
caption: Resettlement blocks in Kowloon

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Children queuing for food, Hong Kong
Description:
Children queuing for food, Hong Kong
City children queue with containers, waiting to receive food rations from a charitable organisation. 
Original Manuscript Caption: Schoolchildren receiving presents of food from a charitable organization
caption: Children queuing for food, Hong Kong

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Victoria Falls
Description:
View of Victoria Falls, situated on the Zambezi River on the border between modern-day Zambia and Zimbabwe. 12 November 1910.

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Saturday, November 12
8.20 A.M. Victoria Falls. Arrive at bridge over Zambesi. See Victoria Falls, North Bank. Plain clothes or khaki uniform will be worn throughout in Rhodesia.
caption: Victoria Falls

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Tea and cake at a royal reception
Description: Dressed in a Western-style suit and top hat, Litunga Lubosi I (Lewanika I) of Barotseland, r.1885-1916, accepts a cup of tea and a slice of cake from an Indian servant at a reception at Government House, Livingstone. 14th November 1910.
caption: Tea and cake at a royal reception

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Entrance to a Presentation of Address
Description: An African man, dressed in a Western-style suit, adjusts a long staff at the entrance to a Presentation of Address for the Duke and Duchess of Connaught, probably at Gwelo, Southern Rhodesia. Arriving guests file past him along a red carpet.
caption: Entrance to a Presentation of Address

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Duke of Connaught inspects the British South Africa Police
Description: The Duke of Connaught salutes as he rides out to inspect a regiment of British South Africa Police, Salisbury, Southern Rhodesia.
caption: Duke of Connaught inspects the British South Africa Police

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Travelling in a portable hammock
Description:
A smiling man is carried along in a portable hammock by a procession of South African naval officers, shortly before boarding the Balmoral Castle. 

Notes from a printed itinerary of the visit:
Friday, December 2
12.35 P.M. Durban. Arrive. Frock coat and tall hat.
12.45 P.M. Town Hall, Presentation of Address.
Lunch on board.
Afternoon. D.L.I. Headquarters. Reception given by Durban Light Infantry. Uniform- blue frock coat and tall hat.
Sleep on board the "Balmoral Castle".
caption: Travelling in a portable hammock

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: Banana stalls at a busy marketplace
Description:
Female traders sell hands of bananas from bowls at a bustling marketplace. 

Original manuscript caption: Banana department of the market, near Volta.
caption: Banana stalls at a busy marketplace

Location: British Empire and Commonwealth Collections at Bristol Archives
Title: African prisoners of war on a British ship
Description: Indian troops sit and stand behind three British Army officers who discuss a group of African prisoners on the deck of a ship. Related images of the British offensive against German East Africa suggest the men had been captured as prisoners of war at the Battle of Tanga.
caption: African prisoners of war on a British ship
